swmod3.F
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 ! Exact-NL RELATED MODULES, file 3 of 3
2 !
3 ! Contents of this file
4 !
5 ! m_constants contains some general constants
6 ! m_fileio information for input / output
7 ! serv_xnl4v5 information for XNL version 5
8 ! m_xnldata contains data for XNL
9 
10 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
11  module m_constants
12 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
13 !
14 ! physical constants
15 !
16  real sqrtg ! square root of gravity
17  real gsq ! square of gravity
18  real nu ! kinematic viscosity of water
19 !
20  real d_water ! density of water
21  real d_air ! density of air
22 
23  real trshdep ! treshold depth (=DEPMIN as given by SWAN)
24 !
25 ! mathematical constants
26 !
27  real pih ! pi/2
28  real dera ! conversion from degrees to radians
29  real rade ! conversion from radians to degrees
30  real expmin ! min argument for exp. function to avoid underflow
31  real expmax ! max argument for exp. function to avoid overflow
32  real sqrt2 ! square root of 2 ~ 1.41
33 !
34  contains
35 !
36 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
37  subroutine init_constants
38 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
39 !
40  USE swcomm3
41 
42  pih = 0.5*pi_w
43  dera = pi_w/180.
44  rade = 180./pi_w
45 !
46  expmin = -20.
47  expmax = 20.
48 !
49 ! physical constants
50 !
51  sqrtg = sqrt(grav_w)
52  gsq = grav_w*grav_w
53  nu = 1.e-6
54  d_air = pwind(16)
55  d_water = pwind(17)
56  trshdep = depmin
57 !
58  end subroutine
59 !
60  end module m_constants
61 
62 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
63  module m_fileio
64 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
65 !
66 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
67 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
68 ! | +---+
69 ! | | +---+ Last update: 8 Feb. 2003
70 ! +---+ | |
71 ! +---+
72 !
73 !
74 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
75 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
76 !
77 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
78 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
79 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
80 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
81 !
82 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
83 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
84 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
85 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
86 !
87 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
88 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
89 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
90 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
91 !
92 !
93 ! Module for storing file i/o related variables
94 !
95 ! The values for the parameter i_log, i_prt and iw_tst must be set
96 ! in one of the routines of the host program or in subroutine sys_init
97 !
98 ! Version 1.1 29 May 2000 Initial version
99 ! 1.2 21 Sep. 2001 Form=binary added (B)
100 ! 1.3 5 Oct. 2001 Form=direct access, unformatted, fixed record (R)
101 ! 1.4 24 Aug. 2002 Bug fixed and restructure of test output
102 ! 1.5 8 Feb. 2003 Error check included when incorrect path (Z_FILEIO)
103 !
104 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
105 ! The following two parameters must be set by the user
106 ! They define the overall test level and the output channel
107 !
108  integer,parameter :: i_print=0 ! (0/1/2) Test output printing off/on
109 ! ! Output channel defined by i_out
110 !
111  integer,parameter :: i_out=6 ! Output channel to screen
112 ! ! ==1 screen output for Unix/Linux systems
113 ! ! ==6 screen output for Windows
114 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
115 !
116 ! Standard switches to activate Logging, Test and Print ouput
117 !
118  integer i_log ! (0/1) Logging off/on
119  integer i_prt ! (0/1) Printing off/on
120  integer i_tst ! (0,1,2...) Test level off/on
121 !
122 !
123 ! Standard unit numbers of input & output files
124 !
125  integer lu_err ! standard error file
126  integer lu_inp ! standard input file
127  integer lu_log ! standard logging
128  integer lu_prt ! standard print output
129  integer lu_tst ! standard test output
130 !
131  character(len=80) :: tempfile ! temporary file to be used for parallel computing
132 !
133  contains
134 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
135  subroutine z_fileio(filename,qual,iufind,iunit,iostat) !
136 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
137 !
138 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
139 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
140 ! | +---+
141 ! | | +---+
142 ! +---+ | |
143 ! +---+
144 !
145 !
146 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
147 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
148 !
149 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
150 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
151 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
152 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
153 !
154 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
155 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
156 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
157 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
158 !
159 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
160 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
161 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
162 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
163 !
164 !
165  use m_parall
166  implicit none
167 !
168 ! 0. Update history
169 !
170 ! 24/07/1999 First version
171 ! 28/09/1999 Module name changed from FILEOPEN -> Z_FILEIO
172 ! 27/10/1999 Option to delete an existing file added
173 ! 18/11/1999 Argument IUNIT used to control use of Z_FLUNIT
174 ! 22/11/1999 Parameter iunit not changed unless by z_flunit
175 ! 28/12/1999 Interface with Z_FLUNIT updated and
176 ! input parameter iufind added
177 ! 14/04/2000 Module m_fileio included in this routine
178 ! 25/05/2000 Module m_fileio excluded, if an already opened file is
179 ! found, the corresponding unit number is assigned to output
180 ! 21/09/2001 Form=binary added, extension to Fortran 95 standard
181 ! 5/10/2001 Form=fixed Record length, as specified in input argument
182 ! 17/06/2002 Initialisation of IUNIT=-1 included
183 ! 24/08/2002 Bug fixed when routine called with IUFIND=0
184 ! 08/02/2003 Bug fixed when file could not be created due to invalid path
185 ! 27/08/2004 Appending node number to FILENAME in case of parallel computing
186 !
187 ! 1. Purpose
188 !
189 ! Open file with name FILENAME and determine unit number IUNIT
190 ! With file type determined in QUAL
191 !
192 ! Depending on the value of IUFIND a search is performed for a
193 ! free unit number
194 !
195 ! 2. Method
196 !
197 ! If file exists then
198 ! if QUAL = 'D'
199 ! delete file
200 ! Else
201 ! inquire if file opened
202 ! If opened
203 ! determine unit number
204 ! Else
205 ! If iunit >= 10 Find free unit number
206 ! Open file with unit number and file qualifier
207 ! End if
208 ! End if
209 ! Else
210 ! If QUAL='SNU'
211 ! If iunit >= 10 find free unit number
212 ! Open new file with unit number and qualifier
213 ! Else
214 ! Iunit = -1 File does not exist
215 ! End if
216 ! End if
217 !
218 !
219 ! 3. Parameter list
220 !
221 !Type I/O Name Description
222 !----------------------------------------------------
223  character(len=*), intent(inout) :: filename ! File name
224  character(len=2), intent(in) :: qual ! File qualifyer
225  integer, intent(in) :: iufind ! Indicator for search of unit number
226  integer, intent(inout) :: iunit ! Unit number
227  integer, intent(out) :: iostat ! Error indicator
228 !
229 ! 4. Subroutines used
230 !
231 ! Z_FLUNIT
232 !
233 ! 5. Error messages
234 !
235 ! IUNIT > 0 File exists, is (already) connected to unit number IUNIT, or is
236 ! created and connected to unit number
237 ! IUNIT == 0 File has been deleted or does not exist
238 ! < 0 An error occurred, no file or unit number found
239 !
240 ! IOSTAT = 0 No errors detected
241 ! -1 Incorrect file qualifier
242 ! -2 Unit number does not exist
243 ! -3 Attempt to open non-existing file with status=OLD
244 ! -4 Attempt to open existing file with wrong FORMATTING
245 ! -5 Incorrect value for IUFIND: not in range [0,1]
246 ! -6 File could not be created due to,e.g. incorrect path
247 !
248 ! 6. Remarks
249 !
250 ! 1) Use of file qualifier:
251 !
252 ! 1st char: O(ld),R(eplace),S(cratch),
253 ! U(nknown),(D)elete
254 ! 2nd char: F(ormatted),U(nformatted),B(inary)
255 !
256 ! 2) Use of IUFIND
257 !
258 ! if IUFIND==0, No search is performed for a free unit number
259 ! ==1, A search is performed in routine Z_FLUNIT
260 !
261 ! 3) This routine is based on routine FOR from
262 ! SWAN version 40.00 of Delft University of Technology
263 !
264 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
265 ! Local variables
266 !
267  character(len=7) :: cstat ! string with status of file I/O
268  character(len=11) :: cform ! string with format of file I/O
269  integer junit ! temporary unit number
270  logical lexist ! indicator if a file exists
271  logical lopen ! indicator if a file is opened
272  integer iuerr ! error indicator from Z_FLUNIT
273  integer ilpos ! start position for appending node number
274 !-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
275 ! initialisations
276 !-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
277  iostat = 0
278  if(iufind==1) iunit = -1
279 !
280 ! Check value of IUFIND
281 !
282  if(iufind/=0 .and. iufind/=1) then
283  if(i_print >0) write(i_out,*) &
284  'Z_FILEIO: Incorrect value for IUFIND:',iufind
285  iostat = -5
286  goto 9999
287  end if
288 !
289  if ( parll .and. iunit <= 0 ) then
290  ilpos = index( filename, ' ' )-1
291  write(filename(ilpos+1:ilpos+4),33) inode
292 33 format('-',i3.3)
293  end if
294 !
295 ! check input argument QUAL
296 !
297  if(i_print>=1) write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO/A:',trim(filename),' ', &
298  qual,iunit,iostat
299 !
300  if (index('ORSUD',qual(1:1)) ==0 .or. &
301  index('FUB',qual(2:2)) ==0) then
302  if(i_print > 0) write(i_out,*) 'Incorrect file qualifier'
303  iostat = -1
304  else
305  if(qual(1:1) == 'O') cstat = 'old'
306  if(qual(1:1) == 'R') cstat = 'replace'
307  if(qual(1:1) == 'S') cstat = 'scratch'
308  if(qual(1:1) == 'U') cstat = 'unknown'
309  if(qual(1:1) == 'D') cstat = 'delete'
310 !
311  if(qual(2:2) == 'F') cform = 'formatted'
312  if(qual(2:2) == 'U') cform = 'unformatted'
313  if(qual(2:2) == 'B') cform = 'binary' ! extension to FORTRAN 95 standard
314  if(qual(2:2) == 'R') cform = 'unformatted'
315 !
316 ! Check if file exists
317 !
318  inquire(file=filename,exist=lexist)
319  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO file exists?:', &
320  trim(filename),':',lexist
321 !
322 ! delete file if it exists and qual == 'D'
323 !
324  if(lexist .and. qual(1:1)=='D') then
325  inquire(file=filename,opened=lopen)
326  if(lopen) then
327  inquire(file=filename,number=junit)
328  else
329  if(iufind == 1) call z_flunit(iunit,iuerr)
330  junit = iunit
331  if(junit > 0) then
332  open(file=filename,unit=junit,form=cform,iostat=iostat)
333  if(iostat/=0) then
334  iostat = -4
335  goto 9999
336  end if
337  end if
338  end if
339  close(junit,status=cstat)
340  goto 9999
341  end if
342 !
343 ! if the file exists, check if it is opened
344 !
345  if(lexist) then
346  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO: File exists:', &
347  trim(filename)
348  inquire(file=filename,opened=lopen)
349  if(lopen) then
350  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO: File is opened:', &
351  trim(filename)
352 !
353 ! determine unit number to which this file is connected
354 ! and assign it to the output number
355 !
356  inquire(file=filename,number=junit)
357  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) &
358  'Z_FILEIO: File is connected to unit:', junit
359  iunit = junit
360  else
361 !
362 ! if the file exists and not connected to a unit number, search a free unit number
363 !
364  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) &
365  'Z_FILEIO: File is not connected to a unit number'
366  if(iufind==0) then
367  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) &
368  'Z_FILEIO: Assign user defined unit number:',iunit
369  elseif(iufind==1) then
370  call z_flunit(iunit,iuerr)
371  if(i_print >=2) write(i_out,*) &
372  'Z_FILEIO: New unit number IUNIT:',iunit
373  end if
374  junit = iunit
375 !
376  if(junit > 0) then
377  open(file=filename,unit=junit,form=cform,status=cstat)
378  else
379  iostat = -2
380  end if
381  end if
382 !
383 ! the file does not exist, so open it and find a free unit number
384 !
385  else
386 !
387  if(i_print>=2) then
388  write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO: File does not exist !'
389  write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO: Qual:',qual(1:1)
390  end if
391 !
392  if(index('SRU',qual(1:1)) > 0) then
393  if(iufind==1) then
394  call z_flunit(iunit,iuerr)
395  if(i_print >=1) write(i_out,*) &
396  'Z_FILEIO: New unit number IUNIT:',iunit
397  end if
398  junit = iunit
399 !
400 ! open file to IUNIT, if possible
401 !
402  if(junit > 0) then
403  open(file=filename,unit=junit,form=cform,iostat=iuerr)
404 !
405 ! check added 8/2/2003
406 !
407  if(iuerr/=0) then
408  iunit = -1
409  iostat = -6
410  end if
411  else
412  iostat = -2
413  end if
414 !
415 ! file cannot be opened because it does not exist
416 !
417  elseif('O'==qual(1:1)) then ! File should exist
418  if(i_print>=2) write(i_out,*) &
419  'Z_FILEIO: File cannot be opened because it does not exist'
420  iostat = -3
421  end if
422  end if
423  end if
424 !
425 9999 continue
426 !
427  if(i_print>=1) write(i_out,*) 'Z_FILEIO/Z:',trim(filename),' ', &
428  qual,iunit,iostat
429 !
430  return
431  end subroutine
432 !
433 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
434  subroutine z_fclose(iunit) !
435 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
436 !
437 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
438 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
439 ! | +---+
440 ! | | +---+
441 ! +---+ | |
442 ! +---+
443 !
444 !
445 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
446 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
447 !
448 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
449 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
450 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
451 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
452 !
453 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
454 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
455 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
456 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
457 !
458 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
459 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
460 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
461 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
462 !
463 !
464  implicit none
465 !
466 ! 0. Update history
467 !
468 ! 0.01 24/08/2000 First version
469 !
470 ! 1. Purpose
471 !
472 ! Close file with unit number IUNIT, and set IUNIT=-1
473 !
474 ! 2. Method
475 !
476 !
477 ! 3. Parameter list
478 !
479 !Type I/O Name Description
480 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
481  integer, intent(inout) :: iunit ! Unit number
482 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
483  close(iunit)
484  iunit = -1
485 !
486  return
487  end subroutine
488 !
489 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
490  subroutine z_flunit(iunit,ierr) !
491 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
492 !
493 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
494 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
495 ! | +---+
496 ! | | +---+
497 ! +---+ | |
498 ! +---+
499 !
500 !
501 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
502 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
503 !
504 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
505 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
506 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
507 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
508 !
509 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
510 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
511 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
512 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
513 !
514 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
515 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
516 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
517 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
518 !
519 !
520  implicit none
521 !
522 ! 0. Update history
523 !
524 ! Version Date Modification
525 !
526 ! 0.01 24/07/1999 Initial version
527 ! 0.02 01/10/1999 Extra check added to ensure maximum unit number
528 ! 0.03 07/10/1999 Check of existence of uni number deleted,
529 ! since this test produces different answer
530 ! on Lahey compiler
531 ! 0.04 25/11/1999 Intent added
532 ! 0.05 24/12/1999 Module M_GENVAR added for information about range of unit numbers
533 ! 0.06 27/12/1999 Module M_GENVAR replaced by M_FILEIO
534 ! Check added for forbidden unit numbers
535 ! 0.07 28/12/1999 Internal checks added and IERR added to parameter list
536 ! 0.08 08/02/2000 User of lu_min & lu_max deleted
537 ! 0.09 14/04/2000 Module m_fileio included in this routine
538 !
539 ! 1. Purpose
540 !
541 ! Find a free unit number
542 !
543 ! 2. Method
544 !
545 ! Starting at LU_MIN till LU_MAX are investigated until
546 ! a free (i.e. not connected to a file) is found.
547 ! Use is made of the standard fortran INQUIRE function.
548 ! The values of LU_MIN and LU_MAX should be specified
549 ! in an initialisation routine
550 !
551 ! 3. Parameter list
552 !
553 !Type I/O Name Description
554 !----------------------------------------------------------
555  integer, intent(out) :: iunit ! resulting unit number
556  integer, intent(out) :: ierr ! error level
557 !
558 ! 4. Subroutines used
559 !
560 ! None
561 !
562 ! 5. Error messages
563 !
564 ! ierr=0 No errors encountered
565 ! 1 Invalud combination lu_low >= lu_high
566 ! 2 Invalid value for lu_low
567 ! 3 Invalid value for lu_high
568 ! 4 No free unit number could be found
569 !
570 ! 6. Remarks
571 !
572 ! If no free unit number if found in the range
573 ! lu_min - lu_high, then the function returns IUNIT = -1
574 !
575 ! The switch i_print can be used to generate test output
576 !
577 !----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
578 ! local parameters
579 !
580  integer junit ! counter for unit numbers
581  logical lopen ! indicator if a unit number is connected to a file
582  logical lnot ! indicates if a forbidden unit number is checked
583  integer i_not ! counter to check forbidded unit numbers
584 !
585 !---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
586 ! range of unit numbers to search
587 !
588  integer, parameter :: lu_min=60 ! minimum unit number
589  integer, parameter :: lu_max=200 ! maximum unit number
590 !
591 ! specification of forbidden unit numbers
592 !
593  integer, parameter :: lu_nr=3 ! number of forbidden unit numbers
594  integer lu_not(lu_nr) ! list of forbidden unit numbers
595 !----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
596  lu_not(1) = 100
597  lu_not(2) = 101
598  lu_not(3) = 102
599 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
600 !
601  ierr = 0
602 !
603  if(i_print >= 2) then
604  write(i_out,*) 'Z_FLUNIT: forbidden :',lu_not
605  write(i_out,*) 'Z_FLUNIT: lu_min lu_max :',lu_min,lu_max
606  end if
607 !
608 ! check data specified in Module Z_FILEIO
609 !
610  if(lu_min >= lu_max) then
611  ierr = 1
612  write(i_out,*) &
613  'Z_FLUNIT: Incorrect boundaries for LU_MIN & LU_MAX:', &
614  lu_min,lu_max
615  end if
616 !
617  junit = lu_min
618 !
619  iunit = -1
620 !
621  do while (iunit ==-1)
622 !
623 ! Check if unit number is free, i.e. not in use by an opened file
624 !
625  inquire(unit=junit,opened=lopen)
626 !
627 ! check if unit number is not a forbidden unit number
628 !
629  lnot = .false.
630  do i_not=1,lu_nr
631  if(lu_not(i_not)==junit) then
632  lnot = .true.
633  if(i_print >= 1) write(i_out,*) &
634  'Z_FLUNIT: a forbidden unit number was encountered:',junit
635  end if
636  end do
637 !
638  if(lopen.or.lnot) then
639  junit = junit + 1
640  else
641  iunit = junit
642  end if
643  if(junit > lu_max) exit
644  end do
645 !
646  if(iunit < 0) then
647  write(i_out,*) &
648  'ERROR in Z_FLUNIT: No free unit number could be found'
649  end if
650 !
651  return
652  end subroutine
653 !
654  end module m_fileio
655 
656  module serv_xnl4v5
657  contains
658  SUBROUTINE y_gauleg(x1,x2,x,w,n)
659 !-------------------------------------------------------------------
660  INTEGER, intent(in) :: n ! Number of intervals
661  real, intent(in) :: x1 ! lower limit of integration interval
662  real, intent(in) :: x2 ! upper limit of integration interval
663  real, intent(out) :: x(n) ! Positions for function evaluations
664  real, intent(out) :: w(n) ! Weights
665 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
666  DOUBLE PRECISION EPS
667  parameter(eps=3.d-14)
668  INTEGER i,j,m
669  DOUBLE PRECISION p1,p2,p3,pp,xl,xm,z,z1
670 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
671  m=(n+1)/2
672  xm=0.5d0*(x2+x1)
673  xl=0.5d0*(x2-x1)
674  do i=1,m
675  z=cos(3.141592654d0*(i-.25d0)/(n+.5d0))
676  1 continue
677  p1=1.d0
678  p2=0.d0
679  do j=1,n
680  p3=p2
681  p2=p1
682  p1=((2.d0*j-1.d0)*z*p2-(j-1.d0)*p3)/j
683  end do
684  pp=n*(z*p1-p2)/(z*z-1.d0)
685  z1=z
686  z=z1-p1/pp
687  if(abs(z-z1).gt.eps)goto 1
688  x(i)=xm-xl*z
689  x(n+1-i)=xm+xl*z
690  w(i)=2.d0*xl/((1.d0-z*z)*pp*pp)
691  w(n+1-i)=w(i)
692  end do
693 !
694  return
695  END subroutine
696 
697 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
698  subroutine z_cmpcg(sigma,depth,grav_w,cg)
699 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
700 !
701 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
702 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
703 ! | +---+
704 ! | | +---+
705 ! +---+ | |
706 ! +---+
707 !
708 !
709 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
710 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
711 !
712 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
713 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
714 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
715 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
716 !
717 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
718 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
719 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
720 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
721 !
722 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
723 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
724 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
725 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
726 !
727 !
728  implicit none
729 !
730 ! 0. Update history
731 !
732 ! 12/01/2001 Initial version
733 ! 11/04/2001 Check included for the cases tat sigma < 0 or depth <0
734 ! Result is cg = -10
735 !
736 ! 1. Purpose:
737 !
738 ! Compute group velocity for a given radian frequency and depth
739 !
740 ! 2. Method
741 !
742 ! Linear wave theory
743 !
744 ! 3. Parameter list:
745 !
746 !Type I/O Name Description
747 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
748  real, intent(in) :: sigma ! radian frequency (rad)
749  real, intent(in) :: depth ! water depth (m)
750  real, intent(in) :: grav_w ! gravitational acceleration (m/s^2)
751  real, intent(out) :: cg ! group velocity (m/s)
752 !
753  real k ! wave number
754 !/A
755 !! real z_wnumb ! compute wave number
756 !/Z
757 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
758  k = z_wnumb(sigma,depth,grav_w)
759 !
760  if(depth <= 0. .or. sigma <= 0.) then
761  cg = -10.
762  else
763  if(depth*k > 30.) then
764  cg = grav_w/(2.*sigma)
765  else
766  cg = sigma/k*(0.5+depth*k/sinh(2.*depth*k))
767  end if
768  end if
769 !
770  return
771  end subroutine
772 !
773 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
774  subroutine z_intp1(x1,y1,x2,y2,n1,n2,ierr) !
775 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
776 !
777 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
778 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
779 ! | +---+
780 ! | | +---+
781 ! +---+ | |
782 ! +---+
783 !
784 !
785 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
786 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
787 !
788 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
789 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
790 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
791 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
792 !
793 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
794 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
795 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
796 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
797 !
798 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
799 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
800 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
801 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
802 !
803 !
804  implicit none
805 !
806 ! 0. Update history
807 !
808 ! 30/03/1999 Initical version
809 ! 9/04/1999 Check included for monotonicity of x-data
810 ! 11/10/1999 Error messages added and updated
811 ! 18/01/2001 Check include if n1==1
812 ! 24/01/2001 Check for equality of y2 data loosened if n2==1
813 ! 13/09/2001 Documentation updated
814 !
815 ! 1. Purpose
816 !
817 ! Interpolate function values
818 !
819 ! 2. Method
820 !
821 ! Linear interpolation
822 
823 ! If a requested point falls outside the input domain, then
824 ! the nearest point is used (viz. begin or end point of x1/y1 array
825 !
826 ! If the input array has only one point. A constant value is assumed
827 !
828 ! 3. Parameter list
829 !
830 ! Name I/O Type Description
831 !
832  integer, intent(in) :: n1 ! number of data points in x1-y1 arrays
833  integer, intent(in) :: n2 ! number of data points in x2-y2 arrays
834  real, intent(in) :: x1(n1) ! x-values of input data
835  real, intent(in) :: y1(n1) ! y-values of input data
836  real, intent(in) :: x2(n2) ! x-values of output data
837  real, intent(out) :: y2(n2) ! y-values of output data
838  integer, intent(out) :: ierr ! Error indicator
839 !
840 ! 4. Subroutines used
841 !
842 ! 5. Error messages
843 !
844 ! ierr = 0 No errors detected
845 ! = 1 x1-data not monotonic increasing
846 ! = 10 x2-data not monotonic increasing
847 ! = 11 x1- and x2 data not monotonic increasing
848 ! = 2 x1-data not monotonic decreasing
849 ! = 20 x1-data not monotonic decreasing
850 ! = 22 x1- and x2 data not monotonic decreasing
851 !
852 ! = 2 No variation in x1-data
853 ! = 3 No variation in x2-data is allowed if n2=1
854 !
855 ! 6. Remarks
856 !
857 ! It is assumed that the x1- and x2-data are either
858 ! monotonic increasing or decreasing
859 !
860 ! If a requested x2-value falls outside the range of x1-values
861 ! it is assumed that the corresponding y2-value is equal to
862 ! the nearest boundary value of the y1-values
863 !
864 ! Example: x1 = [0 1 2 3]
865 ! y1 = [1 2 1 0]
866 !
867 ! x2 = -1, y2 = 1
868 ! x2 = 5, y2 = 0
869 !
870 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
871  integer i1,i2 ! counters
872 !
873  real ds ! step size
874  real fac ! factor in linear interpolation
875  real s1,s2 ! search values
876  real xmin1,xmax1 ! minimum and maximum of x1-data
877  real xmin2,xmax2 ! minimum and maximum of x2-data
878 !
879  real, parameter :: eps=1.e-20
880 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
881 ! initialisation
882 !
883  ierr = 0
884 !
885 ! check number of points of input array
886 !
887  if(n1==1) then
888  y2 = y1(1)
889  goto 9999
890  end if
891 !
892 ! check minimum and maximum data values
893 !
894  xmin1 = minval(x1)
895  xmax1 = maxval(x1)
896  xmin2 = minval(x2)
897  xmax2 = maxval(x2)
898 !
899  if (abs(xmin1-xmax1) < eps .or. abs(x1(1)-x1(n1)) < eps) then
900  ierr = 2
901  goto 9999
902  end if
903 !
904  if ((abs(xmin2-xmax2) < eps .or. abs(x2(1)-x2(n2)) < eps) .and. &
905  n2 > 1) then
906  ierr = 3
907  goto 9999
908  end if
909 !
910 ! check input data for monotonicity
911 !
912  if(x1(1) < x1(n1)) then ! data increasing
913  do i1=1,n1-1
914  if(x1(i1) > x1(i1+1)) then
915  ierr=1
916  write(*,*) 'z_intp1: i1 x1(i1) x1(i1+1):',i1,x1(i1),x1(i1+1)
917  goto 9999
918  end if
919  end do
920 !
921  do i2=1,n2-1
922  if(x2(i2) > x2(i2+1)) then
923  ierr=ierr+10
924  write(*,*) 'z_intp1: i2 x2(i2) x2(i2+1):',i2,x2(i2),x2(i2+1)
925  goto 9999
926  end if
927  end do
928 !
929  else ! data decreasing
930  do i1=1,n1-1
931  if(x1(i1) < x1(i1+1)) then
932  ierr=2
933  write(*,*) 'z_intp1: i1 x1(i1) x1(i1+1):',i1,x1(i1),x1(i1+1)
934  goto 9999
935  end if
936  end do
937 !
938  do i2=1,n2-1
939  if(x2(i2) < x2(i2+1)) then
940  ierr=ierr + 20
941  write(*,*) 'z_intp1: i2 x2(i2) x2(i2+1):',i2,x2(i2),x2(i2+1)
942  goto 9999
943  end if
944  end do
945  end if
946 !
947 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
948 ! initialize
949 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
950  if(ierr==0) then
951  i1 = 1
952  s1 = x1(i1)
953 !
954  do i2 = 1,n2
955  s2 = x2(i2)
956  do while (s1 <= s2 .and. i1 < n1)
957  i1 = i1 + 1
958  s1 = x1(i1)
959  end do
960 !
961 ! special point
962 ! choose lowest s1-value if x2(:) < x1(1)
963 !
964  if(i1 ==1) then
965  y2(i2) = y1(i1)
966  else
967  ds = s2 - x1(i1-1)
968  fac = ds/(x1(i1)-x1(i1-1))
969  y2(i2) = y1(i1-1) + fac*(y1(i1)-y1(i1-1))
970  end if
971 !
972 ! special case at end: choose s2(n2) > s1(n1), choose last value of y1(1)
973 !
974  if(i2==n2 .and. s2>s1) y2(n2) = y1(n1)
975  end do
976  end if
977 !
978  9999 continue
979 !
980  return
981  end subroutine
982 !
983 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
984  subroutine z_polyarea(xpol,ypol,npol,area)
985 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
986 !
987 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
988 ! | | P.O. Box 248
989 ! | +---+ 8300 AE Emmeloord
990 ! | | +---+ Tel: +31 527 620909
991 ! +---+ | | Fax: +31 527 610020
992 ! +---+ http://www.alkyon.nl
993 !
994 ! Gerbrant van Vledder
995 !
996 !
997 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
998 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
999 !
1000 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
1001 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
1002 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
1003 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
1004 !
1005 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
1006 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
1007 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
1008 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
1009 !
1010 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
1011 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
1012 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
1013 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
1014 !
1015 !
1016 ! 0. Update history
1017 !
1018 ! 0.01 12/06/2003 Initial version
1019 !
1020 ! 1. Purpose
1021 !
1022 ! Computes area of a closed polygon
1023 !
1024 ! 2. Method
1025 !
1026 ! The area of the polygon
1027 !
1028 ! 3. Parameter list
1029 !
1030 ! Name I/O Type Description
1031 !
1032  integer, intent(in) :: npol ! Number of points of polygon
1033  real, intent(in) :: xpol(npol) ! x-coodinates of polygon
1034  real, intent(in) :: ypol(npol) ! y-coordinates of polygon
1035  real, intent(out) :: area ! area of polygon
1036 !
1037 ! 4. Subroutines used
1038 !
1039 ! 5. Error messages
1040 !
1041 ! 6. Remarks
1042 !
1043  integer ipol,ipol1 ! counters
1044  real xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax ! minima and maxima of polygon
1045  real xmean,ymean ! mean values
1046  real xa,ya,xb,yb ! temporary variables
1047  real sumx,sumy ! sums
1048  real darea ! piece of area
1049 !-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1050  if(npol<=1) then
1051  crf = 0.
1052  xz = 0.
1053  yz = 0.
1054  area = 0.
1055  return
1056  end if
1057 !
1058 ! compute minimum and maximum coordinates
1059 !
1060  xmin = minval(xpol)
1061  xmax = maxval(xpol)
1062  ymin = minval(ypol)
1063  ymax = maxval(ypol)
1064 !
1065 ! compute mean of range of x- and y-coordinates
1066 !
1067  xmean = 0.5*(xmin + xmax)
1068  ymean = 0.5*(ymin + ymax)
1069 !
1070 ! compute area and center of gravity
1071 ! do loop over all line pieces of polygon
1072 !
1073  area = 0.
1074  sumx = 0.
1075  sumy = 0.
1076 !
1077  do ipol=1,npol
1078  ipol1 = ipol + 1
1079  if(ipol==npol) ipol1 = 1
1080  xa = xpol(ipol)
1081  ya = ypol(ipol)
1082  xb = xpol(ipol1)
1083  yb = ypol(ipol1)
1084 !
1085  darea = 0.5*((xa-xmean)*(yb-ymean) - (xb-xmean)*(ya-ymean))
1086  area = area + darea
1087  sumx = sumx + darea*(xa+xb+xmean)/3.
1088  sumy = sumy + darea*(ya+yb+ymean)/3.
1089  end do
1090 !
1091  return
1092  end subroutine
1093 !
1094 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1095  subroutine z_steps(x,dx,nx)
1096 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1097 !
1098 !
1099 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
1100 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
1101 ! | +---+
1102 ! | | +---+ Creation date: September 28, 1998
1103 ! +---+ | | Last Update: march 19, 2003
1104 ! +---+
1105 !
1106 !
1107 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
1108 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
1109 !
1110 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
1111 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
1112 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
1113 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
1114 !
1115 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
1116 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
1117 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
1118 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
1119 !
1120 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
1121 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
1122 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
1123 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
1124 !
1125 !
1126 ! 0. Update history
1127 !
1128 ! 19/03/2003 Input argument defined using intent option
1129 ! check included nx > 0
1130 !
1131 ! 1. Purpose
1132 !
1133 ! Compute bandwidth of spectral discretization
1134 !
1135  implicit none
1136 !
1137  integer, intent(in) :: nx ! Number of elements in array
1138  real, intent(in) :: x(nx) ! Input data array with elements
1139  real, intent(out) :: dx(nx) ! Output array with step sizes
1140 !
1141  integer ix ! counter
1142 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1143  if (nx<1) then
1144  return
1145 !
1146  elseif (nx==1) then
1147  dx = 0
1148  else
1149  do ix=2,nx-1
1150  dx(ix) = 0.5 * (x(ix+1) - x(ix-1))
1151  end do
1152 !
1153  if (nx >= 4) then
1154  dx(1) = dx(2)*dx(2)/dx(3)
1155  dx(nx) = dx(nx-1)*dx(nx-1)/dx(nx-2)
1156  else
1157  dx(1) = dx(2)
1158  dx(nx) = dx(nx-1)
1159  end if
1160  end if
1161 !
1162  return
1163  end subroutine
1164 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1165  real function z_root2(func,x1,x2,xacc,iprint,ierr)
1166 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1167 !
1168 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
1169 ! | |
1170 ! | +---+
1171 ! | | +---+
1172 ! +---+ | |
1173 ! +---+
1174 !
1175 !
1176 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
1177 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
1178 !
1179 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
1180 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
1181 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
1182 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
1183 !
1184 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
1185 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
1186 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
1187 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
1188 !
1189 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
1190 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
1191 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
1192 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
1193 !
1194 !
1195 ! 0. Update history
1196 !
1197 ! Version Date Modification
1198 !
1199 ! 0.01 29/11/1999 Initial version
1200 ! 0.02 07/11/1999 Test added to check boundaries, and reverse if necessary
1201 ! Bug fixed in assigning answer
1202 ! 0.03 02/09/2002 Maximum number of iterations set to 20, instead of 10
1203 !
1204 ! 1. Purpose
1205 !
1206 ! Find zero crossing point of function FUNC between the
1207 ! initial values on either side of zero crossing
1208 !
1209 ! 2. Method
1210 !
1211 ! Ridders method of root finding
1212 !
1213 ! adapted from routine zridddr
1214 ! Numerical Recipes
1215 ! The art if scientific computing, second edition, 1992
1216 ! W.H. Press, S.A. Teukolsky, W.T. Vetterling and B.P. Flannery
1217 !
1218 ! 3. Parameter list
1219 !
1220 ! Name I/O Type Description
1221 !
1222 ! func i r real function
1223 ! x1 i r initial x-value on left/right side of zero-crossing
1224 ! x2 i r initial x-value on right/left side of zero-crossing
1225 ! xacc i r accuracy, used as |x1(i)-x2(i)|< xacc
1226 ! iprint i i Output channel and test level
1227 ! ierr o i Error indicator
1228 !
1229 ! 4. Subroutines used
1230 !
1231 ! Func user supplied real function
1232 !
1233 ! 5. Error messages
1234 !
1235 ! ierr = 0 No errors occured during iteration process
1236 ! 1 Iteration halted in dead end, this combination may NEVER occur
1237 ! 2 Maximum number of iterations exceeded
1238 ! 3 Solution jumped outside interval
1239 !
1240 ! 6. Remarks
1241 !
1242 ! It is assumed that the x1- and x2-coordinate lie
1243 ! on different sides of the actual zero crossing
1244 !
1245 ! The input parameter IPRINT is used to generate test output.
1246 ! If IPRINT==0, no test output is created
1247 ! > 0, test output is directed to the file connected to unit LUPRINT=IPRINT
1248 ! if no file is connected to this unit, no output is written
1249 !
1250 !
1251  implicit none
1252 !
1253  real func ! external function
1254  real, intent (in) :: x1 ! x-value at one side of interval
1255  real, intent (in) :: x2 ! x-value at other side of interval
1256  real, intent (in) :: xacc ! requested accuracy
1257  integer, intent (in) :: iprint ! number of output channel, only used when
1258  integer, intent (out) :: ierr ! error indicator
1259 !
1260  real unused ! default value
1261  real zriddr ! intermediate function value
1262  real xx1,xx2,xx ! local boundaries during iteration
1263  integer maxit ! maximum number of iteration
1264  integer luprint ! unit of test output
1265  logical lopen ! check if a file is opened
1266 
1267  parameter(maxit = 20)
1268  external func
1269 !
1270  integer iter ! counter for number of iterations
1271  real fh ! function value FUNC(xh)
1272  real fl ! function value FUNC(xl)
1273  real fm ! function value FUNC(xm)
1274  real fnew ! function value FUNC(xnew)
1275  real s ! temp. function value, used for inverse quadratic interpolation
1276  real xh ! upper (high) boundary of interval
1277  real xl ! lower boundary of interval
1278  real xm ! middle point of interval
1279  real xnew ! new estimate according to Ridders method
1280 !
1281  ierr = 0 ! set error level
1282  unused =-1.11e30 ! set start value
1283 !
1284  xx1 = x1 ! copy boundaries of interval to local variables
1285  xx2 = x2
1286 !
1287  luprint = iprint
1288 !
1289  if(luprint > 0) then
1290  inquire(unit=luprint,opened=lopen)
1291  if(.not.lopen) then
1292  luprint = 0
1293  write(*,'(a,i4)') 'Z_ROOT2: invalid unit number:',iprint
1294  end if
1295  end if
1296 !
1297 ! check boundaries on requirement x2 > x1
1298 !
1299  if(xx1 > xx2) then
1300  xx = xx1
1301  xx1 = xx2
1302  xx2 = xx
1303  end if
1304 !
1305  fl = func(xx1)
1306  fh = func(xx2)
1307 !
1308 ! if(luprint > 0) write(luprint,'(a,4e13.5)')
1309 ! & 'Z_ROOT2: xx1 xx2 fl fh:',xx1,xx2,fl,fh
1310 !
1311  if((fl > 0. .and. fh < 0.) .or. (fl < 0. .and. fh > 0.))then
1312  xl = xx1
1313  xh = xx2
1314  zriddr = unused
1315 !
1316  do iter=1,maxit
1317  xm = 0.5*(xl+xh)
1318  fm = func(xm)
1319  s = sqrt(fm**2-fl*fh)
1320  if(s == 0.) goto 9000
1321  xnew = xm+(xm-xl)*(sign(1.,fl-fh)*fm/s)
1322 !
1323 ! if(luprint>0) write(luprint,'(a,4e13.5)')
1324 !& 'Z_ROOT2: xm,fm,s,xnew:',xm,fm,s,xnew
1325 !
1326  if (abs(xnew-zriddr) <= xacc) then
1327 ! if(luprint>0) write(luprint,'(a)') 'Z_ROOT2: xnew=zriddr'
1328  goto 9000
1329  end if
1330 !
1331  zriddr = xnew
1332  fnew = func(zriddr)
1333  if (fnew == 0.) goto 9000
1334 !
1335  if(sign(fm,fnew) /= fm) then
1336  xl = xm
1337  fl = fm
1338  xh = zriddr
1339  fh = fnew
1340  elseif(sign(fl,fnew) /= fl) then
1341  xh = zriddr
1342  fh = fnew
1343  elseif(sign(fh,fnew) /= fh) then
1344  xl = zriddr
1345  fl = fnew
1346  else
1347  ierr = 1
1348  goto 9000
1349  endif
1350 !
1351  if(abs(xh-xl) <= xacc) goto 9000
1352 !
1353  if(luprint > 0) write(luprint,'(a,i4,5e14.6)') &
1354  'Z_ROOT2: iter,x1,x2,|x1-x2|,xacc,z:', iter,xl,xh, &
1355  abs(xl-xh),xacc,fnew
1356 !
1357  end do
1358  ierr = 2
1359  if(luprint > 0) write(luprint,'(a)') 'Z_ROOT2: -> ierr=2'
1360  goto 9000
1361  else if (fl == 0.) then
1362  zriddr = xx1
1363  else if (fh == 0.) then
1364  zriddr = xx2
1365  else
1366  ierr = 3
1367  goto 9999
1368 ! 'root must be bracketed in zriddr'
1369  endif
1370 !
1371  9000 continue
1372 !
1373  z_root2 = zriddr
1374 !
1375  if(luprint > 0) write(luprint,'(a,2i3,5e13.5)') &
1376  'Z_ROOT2: ierr,iter,xl,xh,acc,x0,z0:', ierr,iter,xl,xh,xacc, &
1377  z_root2,func(z_root2)
1378 !
1379  9999 continue
1380 !
1381  return
1382  end function
1383 !
1384 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1385  subroutine z_upper(str)
1386 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1387 !
1388 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
1389 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
1390 ! | +---+
1391 ! | | +---+ Creation date: July 3,1998
1392 ! +---+ | | Last Update:
1393 ! +---+
1394 !
1395 !
1396 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
1397 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
1398 !
1399 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
1400 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
1401 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
1402 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
1403 !
1404 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
1405 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
1406 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
1407 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
1408 !
1409 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
1410 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
1411 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
1412 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
1413 !
1414 !
1415 ! 0. Update history
1416 !
1417 ! 1. Purpose
1418 !
1419 ! Transform all lower capitals to UPPER CAPITALS in string STR
1420 !
1421 ! 2. Method
1422 !
1423 ! 3. Parameter list
1424 !
1425 ! Name I/O Type Description
1426 !
1427  implicit none
1428  character(len=*), intent(inout) :: str ! Character string to be converted
1429 !
1430 ! 4. Subroutines used
1431 !
1432 ! 5. Error messages
1433 !
1434 ! 6. Remarks
1435 !
1436  integer nlen
1437  integer i,ial,iau,izl
1438 !
1439  nlen = len(str)
1440 !
1441  ial = ichar('a')
1442  iau = ichar('A')
1443  izl = ichar('z')
1444 !
1445  do i=1,nlen
1446  if(ichar(str(i:i)) >= ial.and. ichar(str(i:i)) <= izl) then
1447  str(i:i) = char(ichar(str(i:i))-ial+iau)
1448  end if
1449  end do
1450 !
1451  return
1452  end subroutine
1453 !
1454 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1455  real function z_wnumb(w,d,grav_w)
1456 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------!
1457 !
1458 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
1459 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
1460 ! | +---+
1461 ! | | +---+
1462 ! +---+ | |
1463 ! +---+
1464 !
1465 !
1466 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
1467 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
1468 !
1469 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
1470 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
1471 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
1472 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
1473 !
1474 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
1475 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
1476 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
1477 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
1478 !
1479 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
1480 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
1481 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
1482 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
1483 !
1484 !
1485  implicit none
1486 !
1487 ! 0. Update history
1488 !
1489 ! 01/04/1999 Initial version
1490 ! 12/01/2001 grav added as input parameter
1491 ! 11/04/2001 Check included for the case w < 0 or d < 0
1492 !
1493 ! 1. Purpose:
1494 !
1495 ! Compute wave number k for a given radian frequency and water depth
1496 !
1497 ! 2. Method
1498 !
1499 ! finite depth linear dispersion relation, using a Pade approximation
1500 !
1501 ! 3. Parameter list:
1502 !
1503 !Type I/O Name Description
1504 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1505  real, intent(in) :: w ! radian frequency (rad)
1506  real, intent(in) :: d ! water depth (m)
1507  real, intent(in) :: grav_w ! gravitational acceleration (m/s^2)
1508 !
1509 ! 4. Subroutines used
1510 !
1511 ! 5. Error messages
1512 !
1513 ! 6. Remarks
1514 !
1515 ! The Pade approximation has been described in Hunt, 198.
1516 !
1517  real x,xx,y,omega
1518 !
1519  if(d<=0 .or. w<= 0.) then
1520  z_wnumb = -10.
1521  else
1522  omega = w**2/grav_w
1523  y = omega*d
1524  xx = y*(y+1./(1.+y*(0.66667+y*(0.35550+y*(0.16084+y* &
1525  (0.06320+y*(0.02174+y*(0.00654+y*(0.00171+y* &
1526  (0.00039+y*0.00011))))))))))
1527  x = sqrt(xx)
1528  z_wnumb = x/d
1529  end if
1530 !
1531  return
1532  end function
1533  end module
1534 
1535 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1536  module m_xnldata
1537 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1538 ! module for computing the quadruplet interaction
1539 ! Created by Gerbrant van Vledder
1540 !
1541 ! version 1.01 16/02/1999 Initial version
1542 ! 2.01 01/10/2001 various extensions added
1543 ! 3.1.01 01/10/2001 Array's for k4 -locus added
1544 ! 3.2 12/05/2002 Triplet data added
1545 ! 4.00 08/08/2002 Upgrade to version 4.0
1546 ! 4.01 19/08/2002 Various modifications for consistency reasons
1547 ! 5.01 9/09/2002 Length of strings aqname and bqname modified
1548 ! q_dstep added, step for BQF files
1549 ! 11/09/2002 Filtering variables added
1550 ! 5.02 12/04/2003 Switch for triplet variables corrected
1551 ! 5.03 26/05/2003 Switch for lumping along locus added
1552 ! 04/06/2003 Switch for Gauss-Legendre integration added
1553 ! 06/06/2003 Switch iq_xdia added and NXDIA removed
1554 ! 12/06/2003 Loop indices ik1,ia1,ik3,ia1 added
1555 ! 16/06/2003 Switch IQ_SYM introduced
1556 ! 04/09/2003 Version string set in subroutine q_version
1557 ! 09/09/2003 Parameter id_facmax introduced
1558 ! 5.04 24/12/2003 Tail factors for k2 and k4 always in BQF
1559 ! 30/12/2003 Parameters IQ_TAIL & FF_TAIL added
1560 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1561  implicit none
1562 !
1563  character(len=60) q_version ! version string
1564 !
1565  character(len=20) sub_name ! Name of active subroutine
1566  character(len=20) qbase ! base name for I/O files
1567  character(len=20) qf_error ! name of file with error messages
1568 !
1569  integer iufind ! Specifies handling of unit numbers, see Z_FILEIO
1570  integer iscreen ! identifier for screen, set in XNL_INIT
1571 !
1572 ! unit numbers for I/O
1573 !
1574  integer luq_bqf ! binary file storing and retrieving precomputed loci
1575  integer luq_cfg ! user defined configuration
1576  integer luq_err ! file with error messages
1577  integer luq_fil ! test output for filtering
1578  integer luq_grd ! ASCII file storing and retrieving precomputed loci
1579  integer luq_int ! test file for test output of integration
1580  integer luq_loc ! statistics about computed loci
1581  integer luq_log ! logging
1582  integer luq_prt ! general print file for quadruplets
1583  integer luq_trf ! testing transformation of loci
1584  integer luq_tst ! test file for quadruplets
1585  integer luq_txt ! reading (error) text file
1586  integer luq_t13 ! test of basis integration
1587 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1588 ! physical coefficients, to be obtained through interface XNL_INIT
1589 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1590  real q_grav ! gravitational acceleration (Earth = 9.81 m/s^2)
1591  real qf_tail ! power of spectral tail of E(f), e.g. -4,, -4.5, -5
1592 ! ! these values must be set in the interface routine
1593 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1594 ! filtering coefficients
1595 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1596  real qf_krat ! maximum ratio of the interacting wave numbers k1 and k3
1597  real qf_dmax ! maximum directional difference between k1 and k3
1598  real qf_frac ! fraction of maximum action density to filter
1599 !
1600 ! program switches, optionally to be reset in routine Q_SETCONFIG
1601 !
1602  integer iq_compact ! switch to compact data
1603 ! == 0, do not compact
1604 ! == 1, compact data by elimiting zero contribution along locus
1605 !
1606  integer iq_cple ! type of coupling coefficient
1607 ! == 1, deep water coefficient of Webb
1608 ! == 2, deep water coefficient of Zakharov
1609 ! == 3, finite depth coefficient of Hasselmann & Herterich
1610 ! == 4, finite depth coefficient of Zakharov
1611 ! == 5, finite depth coefficient of Lin & Perrie
1612 !
1613  integer iq_disp ! type of dispersion relation, viz. depth dependency
1614 ! == 1, deep water, possibly with geometric scaling
1615 ! == 2, linear dispersion relation, w^2 = g.k.tanh(kd)
1616 ! == 3, nonlinear dispersion relation
1617 !
1618  integer iq_dscale ! switch to activate depth scaling according to
1619  ! Herterich and Hasselmann
1620 ! ! == 0, No depth scaling
1621 ! ! == 1, depth scaling activated
1622 !
1623  integer iq_filt ! switch to activate filtering in wave number space
1624 ! ! ==0, no filtering
1625 ! ! ==1, filtering activated
1626 !
1627  integer iq_gauleg ! switch for Gauss-Legendre interpolation
1628 ! ! == 0, No Gauss-Legendre, default
1629 ! ! > 0 Gauss-Legendre, iq_gauleg is number of points
1630 !
1631  integer iq_geom ! type of scaling
1632 ! == 0, no geometric scaling, only directional scaling of loci
1633 ! == 1, geometric scaling using Resio/Tracy method
1634 ! only possible in the case IQ_DISP=1
1635 !
1636  integer iq_grid ! type of spectral grid
1637 ! == 1, sector & symmetric around zero
1638 ! == 2, sector & symmetric around zero & non-symmetric
1639 ! == 3, full circle & non-symmetric
1640 !
1641  integer iq_integ ! option to output integration results
1642 ! ! ==0 no output of integration
1643 ! ! ==1 only sum per locus
1644 ! ! ==2 also information per point on locus
1645 ! ! ==3 only basic line integrals
1646 !
1647  integer iq_interp ! type of interpolation to retrieve action density
1648 ! ! == 1, bi-linear interpolation in discrete spectrum (default)
1649 ! ! == 2, take nearest bins, on the basis of maximum weight
1650 !
1651  integer iq_locus ! Option for computation of locus
1652 ! ! ==1, explicit polar method with fixed k-step
1653 ! ! ==2, explicit polar method with adpative k-stepping
1654 ! ! ==3, explicit polar method with geometric k-spacing
1655 !
1656  integer iq_log ! switch to activate logging to file QBASE//.LOG
1657 ! ! == 0, No print output
1658 ! ! == 1, print output
1659 !
1660  integer iq_lump ! switch to activate lumping on locus
1661 ! ! == 0, No lumping
1662 ! ! == 1, Lumping along locus
1663 !
1664  integer iq_make ! option to make quadruplet grid
1665 ! == 1, make when needed (default)
1666 ! == 2, always make quadruplet grid
1667 ! == 3, only make grid file
1668 !
1669  integer iq_mod ! option to redistribute points on locus
1670 ! ! == 0, Points will be used as computed by tracing algortihm
1671 ! ! == 1, Equi-distant spacing on points along locus (NLOC1)
1672 !
1673  integer iq_prt ! switch to activate print output, to file QBASE//.PRT
1674 ! ! == 0, No print output
1675 ! ! == 1, print output
1676 !
1677  integer iq_search ! switch to determine search for a proper grid
1678 ! == 0, no search is carried out
1679 ! == 1, search nearest (relative) interaction grid
1680 !
1681  integer iq_screen ! option to send output to the screen
1682 ! ! == 0, no output is send to screen
1683 ! ! == 1, output is send to screen
1684 !
1685  integer iq_sym ! switch to activate use of symmetry reduction
1686 ! ! == 0, no symmetries are used
1687 ! ! == 1, symmetry activated (default)
1688 !
1689  integer iq_tail ! add parametric tail to transfer rate and diagnonal term
1690 ! ! == 0, no tail is added
1691 ! ! == 1, parametric tail is added
1692 !
1693  integer iq_test ! test level, output is directed to unit luqtst
1694 ! ! == 0, no test output
1695 ! ! == 1, output of basic I/O
1696 ! ! == 2, extensive test output
1697 !
1698  integer iq_trace ! trace option
1699 ! ! == 0, no trace of subroutine calls
1700 ! ! > 0, maximum number of traces per subroutine
1701 ! ! < 0, as for >0 but now output is send to the screen
1702 !
1703  integer iq_trf ! option to print transformed loci to special output file
1704 ! ! == 0, no output to data file unit luqtrf
1705 ! ! == 1, test output from routine Q_GETLOCUS
1706 !
1707  integer iq_t13 ! option to output T13 integration
1708 ! ! ==0, no output
1709 ! ! ==1, test output of T13 per locus
1710 !
1711  integer iq_xdia ! switch to activate output to extended DIA data file
1712 ! == 0, no output
1713 ! > 0, output to data file, but only when lumping is also
1714 ! activated
1715 !---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1716 !
1717 !
1718 ! grid administration
1719 !
1720  character(len=17) aqname ! name of ASCII grid file
1721  character(len=17) bqname ! name of binary quadruplet grid file
1722  character(len=17) lastquadfile ! name of last retrieved BQF file
1723  character(len=21) q_header ! header of Binary Quadruplet File as intended in BQF-file
1724  character(len=21) r_header ! header of Binary Quadruplet File as exists in BQF-file
1725  logical lq_grid ! flag to make (new) interaction grid
1726 !
1727  integer nkq ! number of wave numbers of quad-grid
1728  integer naq ! number of angles of quad-grad
1729  integer ncirc ! number of angles on a full circle
1730 !
1731  integer ia_k1,ik_k1 ! indices of main loop variables
1732  integer ia_k3,ik_k3 ! indices of main loop variables
1733 !
1734  real fqmin ! lowest frequency in Hz
1735  real fqmax ! highest frequency in Hz
1736  real q_sector ! half plane width in degrees (for iq_grid=1,2)
1737  real q_dstep ! step size for generating BQF files
1738 !
1739  integer, parameter :: mq_stack=10 ! maximum number of elements in stack
1740 !
1741  integer mlocus ! maximum number of points on locus for defining arrays
1742  integer nlocus0 ! preferred number of points on locus
1743  integer nlocus1 ! number of points on locus as computed in Q_CMPLOCUS
1744  integer klocus ! number of points on locus as stored in quadruplet database
1745  ! based on nlocus0, iq_gauleg and iq_lump (without compacting)
1746  ! used in Q_ALLOCATE to define size of data arrays
1747  integer nlocus ! number of points on locus, equal to klocus
1748  integer nlocusx ! number of points on locus for use in computation (nlocusx <= nlocus)
1749 !
1750  real kqmin ! lowest wave number
1751  real kqmax ! highest wave number
1752  real wk_max ! maximum weight for wave number interpolation, set in Q_INIT
1753 !
1754  real k0x,k0y,dk0 ! components of initial wave number of locus,
1755  real krefx,krefy ! components of reference wave number for quad-grid
1756  real k1x,k1y ! components of k1 wave number
1757  real k2x,k2y ! components of k2 wave number
1758  real k3x,k3y ! components of k3 wave number
1759  real k4x,k4y ! components of k4 wave number
1760  real px,py ! components of difference k1-k3 wave number
1761  real pmag ! magnitude of P-vector
1762  real pang ! angle related of P-vector, Pang = atan2(py,px), (radians)
1763  real sang ! angle of symmytry axis of locus, SANG = PANG +/ pi (radians)
1764  real xang ! angle of locus for the case that w1=w3, Xang=atan2(-px,py), (radians)
1765  real q ! difference of radian frequencies, used in Resio-Tracy method
1766  real kmin_loc ! minimum wave number of locus along symmetry axis
1767  real kmax_loc ! maximum wave number of locus along symmetry axis
1768  real kmid ! wave number at midpoint of locus along symmetry axis
1769  real kmidx ! x-component of wave number at midpoint of locus along symmetry axis
1770  real kmidy ! y-component of wave number at midpoint of locus along symmetry axis
1771  real loc_crf ! circumference of locus in (kx,ky)-space
1772  real loc_area ! area of locus, measured in (kx-ky)- space
1773  real loc_xz ! x-coordinate of center of gravity of locus in (kx,ky)-space
1774  real loc_yz ! y-coordinate of center of gravity of locus in (kx,ky)-space
1775 !
1776 ! data for extended input k-grid, necessary when input grid is smaller than
1777 ! internal k-grid.
1778 !
1779 ! real fackx ! geometric spacing factor of input grid
1780 ! integer nkx ! new number of k-rings of extended input grid
1781 ! real, allocatable :: kx(:) ! extended k-grid
1782 ! real, allocatable :: nspecx(:,:) ! extended action density spectrum
1783 !
1784 ! information about pre_computed locus, only half the angles need to be saved
1785 !
1786 !
1787  integer, allocatable :: quad_nloc(:,:) ! number of points on locus
1788  integer, allocatable :: quad_ik2(:,:,:) ! lower wave number index of k2
1789  integer, allocatable :: quad_ia2(:,:,:) ! lower direction index of k2
1790  integer, allocatable :: quad_ik4(:,:,:) ! lower wave number index of k4
1791  integer, allocatable :: quad_ia4(:,:,:) ! lower direction index of k4
1792  real, allocatable :: quad_w1k2(:,:,:) ! weight 1 of k2
1793  real, allocatable :: quad_w2k2(:,:,:) ! weight 2 of k2
1794  real, allocatable :: quad_w3k2(:,:,:) ! weight 3 of k2
1795  real, allocatable :: quad_w4k2(:,:,:) ! weight 4 of k2
1796  real, allocatable :: quad_w1k4(:,:,:) ! weight 1 of k4
1797  real, allocatable :: quad_w2k4(:,:,:) ! weight 2 of k4
1798  real, allocatable :: quad_w3k4(:,:,:) ! weight 3 of k4
1799  real, allocatable :: quad_w4k4(:,:,:) ! weight 4 of k4
1800  real, allocatable :: quad_zz (:,:,:) ! compound product of cple*ds*sym/jac
1801  real, allocatable :: quad_t2(:,:,:) ! tail factors for k2 wave number
1802  real, allocatable :: quad_t4(:,:,:) ! tail factors for k4 wave number
1803  real, allocatable :: quad_sym(:,:,:) ! symmetry factor btween k1-k3 and k1-k4
1804  real, allocatable :: quad_jac(:,:,:) ! jacobian term
1805  real, allocatable :: quad_cple(:,:,:) ! coupling coefficient
1806  real, allocatable :: quad_ws (:,:,:) ! (weighted) step size
1807 !
1808 ! characteristic of computed locus
1809 !
1810  real, allocatable :: x2_loc(:) ! k2x coordinates around locus
1811  real, allocatable :: y2_loc(:) ! k2y coordinates around locus
1812  real, allocatable :: z_loc(:) ! data value around locus
1813  real, allocatable :: s_loc(:) ! coordinate along locus
1814  real, allocatable :: x4_loc(:) ! k4x coordinates around locus
1815  real, allocatable :: y4_loc(:) ! k4y coordinates around locus
1816  real, allocatable :: ds_loc(:) ! step size around locus
1817  real, allocatable :: jac_loc(:) ! jacobian term around locus
1818  real, allocatable :: cple_loc(:) ! coupling coefficient around locus
1819  real, allocatable :: sym_loc(:) ! factor for symmetry between k3 and k4
1820 !
1821  real, allocatable :: k_pol(:) ! wave numbers during polar generation of locus
1822  real, allocatable :: c_pol(:) ! cosines during polar generation of locus
1823  real, allocatable :: a_pol(:) ! angles of polar locus
1824 !
1825 ! characteristics of modified locus, result
1826 !
1827  real, allocatable :: x2_mod(:) ! k2x coordinates along locus
1828  real, allocatable :: y2_mod(:) ! k2y coordinates along locus
1829  real, allocatable :: x4_mod(:) ! k4x coordinates along locus
1830  real, allocatable :: y4_mod(:) ! k4y coordinates along locus
1831  real, allocatable :: z_mod(:) ! data value around locus
1832  real, allocatable :: s_mod(:) ! coordinate along locus
1833  real, allocatable :: ds_mod(:) ! step size around locus
1834  real, allocatable :: jac_mod(:) ! jacobian term around locus
1835  real, allocatable :: cple_mod(:) ! coupling coefficient around locus
1836  real, allocatable :: sym_mod(:) ! factor for symmetry between k3 and k4
1837 !
1838  real, allocatable :: k2m_mod(:) ! k2 magnitude around locus
1839  real, allocatable :: k2a_mod(:) ! k2 angle around locus
1840  real, allocatable :: k4m_mod(:) ! k4 magnitude around locus
1841  real, allocatable :: k4a_mod(:) ! k4 angle around locus
1842 !
1843 ! result of subroutine Q_weight
1844 !
1845  real, allocatable :: wk_k2(:) ! position of k2 and k4 wave number
1846  real, allocatable :: wk_k4(:) ! w.r.t. discrete k-grid
1847  real, allocatable :: wa_k2(:) ! position of k2 and k4 wave number
1848  real, allocatable :: wa_k4(:) ! w.r.t. discrete a-grid
1849  real, allocatable :: wt_k2(:) ! weight factor in tail,
1850  real, allocatable :: wt_k4(:) ! wt==1 for wave numbers inside k-grid
1851 !
1852  integer, allocatable :: t_ik2(:) ! transformed weight for k2-magnitude
1853  integer, allocatable :: t_ia2(:) ! transformed direction for k2
1854  integer, allocatable :: t_ik4(:) ! transformed tail factor for k2
1855  integer, allocatable :: t_ia4(:) ! transformed weight for k4
1856  real, allocatable :: t_w1k2(:) ! transformed weight 1 for k2
1857  real, allocatable :: t_w2k2(:) ! transformed weight 2 for k2
1858  real, allocatable :: t_w3k2(:) ! transformed weight 3 for k2
1859  real, allocatable :: t_w4k2(:) ! transformed weight 4 for k2
1860  real, allocatable :: t_w1k4(:) ! transformed weight 1 for k4
1861  real, allocatable :: t_w2k4(:) ! transformed weight 2 for k4
1862  real, allocatable :: t_w3k4(:) ! transformed weight 3 for k4
1863  real, allocatable :: t_w4k4(:) ! transformed weight 4 for k4
1864  real, allocatable :: t_zz(:) ! product term
1865  real, allocatable :: t_tail2(:) ! tail factor for k2
1866  real, allocatable :: t_tail4(:) ! tail factor for k4
1867  real, allocatable :: t_sym(:) ! transformed symetry factor
1868  real, allocatable :: t_cple(:) ! transformed coupling coefficient
1869  real, allocatable :: t_jac(:) ! tranformed jacobian term
1870  real, allocatable :: t_ws(:) ! transformed weighted/step size
1871 !
1872 ! corresponding declarations
1873 !
1874  integer, allocatable :: r_ik2(:)
1875  integer, allocatable :: r_ia2(:)
1876  integer, allocatable :: r_ik4(:)
1877  integer, allocatable :: r_ia4(:)
1878  real, allocatable :: r_w1k2(:),r_w2k2(:),r_w3k2(:),r_w4k2(:)
1879  real, allocatable :: r_w1k4(:),r_w2k4(:),r_w3k4(:),r_w4k4(:)
1880  real, allocatable :: r_zz(:),r_jac(:),r_cple(:),r_sym(:),r_ws(:)
1881  real, allocatable :: r_tail2(:),r_tail4(:)
1882 !
1883  real, allocatable :: dt13(:) ! increment along locus
1884 !
1885  real, allocatable :: q_xk(:) ! extended wave number array starting at index 0
1886  real, allocatable :: q_sk(:) ! step size of extended wave number array
1887  real sk_max ! maximum wave number in extended array
1888 !
1889  real, allocatable :: q_k(:) ! wave number grid [1/m]
1890  real, allocatable :: q_dk(:) ! width of wave number bins [1/m]
1891  real, allocatable :: q_kpow(:) ! wave number to a certain power, used in filtering
1892  real, allocatable :: q_f(:) ! frequencies accociated to wave number/depth
1893  real, allocatable :: q_df(:) ! step size of frequency grid
1894  real, allocatable :: q_sig(:) ! radian frequencies associated to wave number/depth
1895  real, allocatable :: q_dsig(:) ! step size of radian frequency grid
1896  real, allocatable :: q_cg(:) ! group velocity (m/s)
1897  real, allocatable :: q_a(:) ! directions of quadruplet grid in radians
1898  real, allocatable :: q_ad(:) ! directions of quadruplet grid in degrees
1899  real, allocatable :: a(:,:) ! Action density on wave number grid A(sigma,theta)
1900  real, allocatable :: nspec(:,:) ! Action density on wave number grid N(kx,ky)
1901  real, allocatable :: nk1d(:) ! Internal 1d action density spectrum N(k)
1902  real, allocatable :: qnl(:,:) ! Nonlinear energy transfer Snl(k,theta)
1903 !
1904  integer id_facmax ! Factor for determining range of depth search (Q_SEARCHGRID)
1905  real q_dird1,q_dird2 ! first and last direction of host model (via XNL_INIT) degrees
1906  real q_depth ! local water depth in m
1907  real q_maxdepth ! maximum water depth, set in XNL_INIT, used in Q_CTRGRID
1908  real q_mindepth ! minimum water depth, set in XNL_INIT, used in Q_CTRGRID
1909  real q_lambda ! geometric scaling factor for 'deep' water loci
1910  real q_scale ! additional scale factor resulting from SEARCH for neasrest grid
1911 !
1912  real eps_q ! absolute accuracy for check of Q
1913  real eps_k ! absolute accuracy for equality check of k
1914  real rel_k ! relative accuracy for equality check of k
1915 !
1916  integer iq_stack ! Sequence number of stack with subroutine calls
1917  character(len=21) cstack(mq_stack) ! Stack with module names
1918 !
1919 ! characteristics of locus
1920 !
1921  real crf1 ! estimated circumference of locus
1922 !---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1923 !
1924 ! information about type of grid
1925 !
1926  integer iaref ! index of first angle of reference wave numbers
1927  integer iamax ! maximum difference in indices for sector grids
1928  integer iaq1,iaq2 ! indices of do-loop for directions
1929  integer iag1,iag2 ! range of directions for precomputed interaction grid
1930  real q_ang1,q_ang2 ! lower and upper angle of grid in degrees
1931  real q_delta ! directional spacing of angular grid in radians
1932  real q_deltad ! directional spacing of angular grid in degrees
1933 !
1934  real q_ffac ! geometric factor between subsequent frequencies
1935  real q_kfac ! geometric factor between subsequent wave numbers
1936  ! (only valid for IQ_IDISP==1)
1937  real qk_tail ! power of spectral tail of N(k), computed from qf_tail
1938  real ff_tail ! fraction of maximum frequency where parametric tail starts
1939 !
1940 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1941 !
1942 !!/R real wq2(4) ! interpolation weights for k2
1943 !!/R real wq4(4) ! interpolation weights for k4
1944 !!/R real wqw ! overall weight of contribution
1945 !!/R real wtriq(40) ! triplet weights
1946 !!/R integer ikq2(4) ! wave number index for k2
1947 !!/R integer idq2(4) ! angle index for k2
1948 !!/R integer ikq4(4) ! wave number index for k4
1949 !!/R integer idq4(4) ! angle index for k4
1950 !!/R integer iktriq(40,3) ! k-indices of triplets
1951 !!/R integer idtriq(40,3) ! direction indices of triplets
1952 
1953 !
1954 !============== General settings =================
1955 !
1956  integer iq_type ! method for computing the nonlinear interactions
1957 ! depending on the value of iq_type a number of settings
1958 ! for other processes or schematizations are set in Q_COMPU
1959 ! iq_type==1: deep water, symmetric spectrum, Webb coupling coefficient
1960 ! 2: deep water computation with WAM depth scaling based on Herterich
1961 ! and Hasselmann (1980)
1962 ! 3: finite depth transfer
1963 !
1964  integer iq_err ! counts the number of errors
1965 ! if no error occurred, IQ_ERR = 0
1966 ! for each occuring error, iq_err is incremented
1967 ! errors are always terminating
1968 ! routine Q_ERROR handles the reporting on the error
1969 !
1970  integer iq_warn ! counts the number of warnings
1971 !
1972 ! indices for test output of actual integration
1973 ! these values are set and optionally modified in Q_SETCONFIG
1974 !
1975  integer mk1a,mk1b ! indices of k1 when test output is needed
1976  integer mk3a,mk3b ! indices of k3 when test output is needed
1977  contains
1978 !----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1979 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1980  subroutine xnl_init(sigma,dird,nsigma,ndir,pftail,x_grav,depth, &
1981 ! ndepth,jquad,iqgrid,iproc,ierror)
1982  ndepth,jquad,iqgrid,ierror)
1983 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1984 !
1985 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
1986 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
1987 ! | +---+
1988 ! | | +---+ Last update: 6 May 2004
1989 ! +---+ | | Release: 5.03
1990 ! +---+
1991 !
1992 !
1993 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
1994 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
1995 !
1996 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
1997 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
1998 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
1999 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
2000 !
2001 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
2002 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
2003 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
2004 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
2005 !
2006 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
2007 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
2008 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2009 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
2010 !
2011 !
2012  use m_fileio
2013  use m_constants
2014 ! do not use m_xnldata
2015 !
2016  implicit none
2017 !
2018 ! 0. Update history
2019 !
2020 ! 10/01/2001 Initial version
2021 ! 14/02/2001 Release 3
2022 ! 06/11/2001 Depth forced to 1000 when iquad ==1,2
2023 ! 08/08/2002 Upgrade to version 4
2024 ! 19/08/2002 Extra test output
2025 ! 22/08/2002 User defined directions stored in Quad-system
2026 ! 26/08/2002 Minimum water depth in variable q_mindepth
2027 ! 09/09/2002 Initialized LASTQUADFILE
2028 ! 10/09/2002 Initialisation of Q_DSTEP
2029 ! 11/09/2002 Called of Q_ALLOC moved to location after Q_SETCFG
2030 ! Output unit luq_fil added
2031 ! 16/09/2002 Parameter IPROC added to take are of MPI
2032 ! 25/09/2002 Check added for directions of sector grid
2033 ! 25/04/2003 name q_alloc changed to q_allocate
2034 ! 04/06/2003 variable IQ_INT renamed IQ_INTEG
2035 ! 11/06/2003 Call to Q_SETCFG changed into Q_SETCONFIG
2036 ! Call to Q_CHKCFG changed into Q_CHKCONFIG
2037 ! Call to subroutine Q_SUMMARY added
2038 ! Compute size of points on locus, stored in KLOCUS
2039 ! 13/06/2003 Test parameters moved to Q_SETCONFIG
2040 ! 04/09/2003 Routine Q_SETVERSION added
2041 ! 27/04/2004 Check added for directions of sector grid
2042 ! 06/05/2004 Initialisation of IQ_INTERP removed
2043 !
2044 ! 1. Purpose:
2045 !
2046 ! Initialize coefficients, integration space, file i/o for computation
2047 ! nonlinear quadruplet wave-wave interaction
2048 !
2049 ! 2. Method
2050 !
2051 ! Set version number
2052 ! Set unit unit numbers
2053 ! Open quad related files
2054 ! Optionally reset configuration by a back door option
2055 ! Compute integration spaces for given water depths
2056 !
2057 ! 3. Parameter list:
2058 !
2059 !Type I/O Name Description
2060 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2061  integer, intent(in) :: nsigma ! Number of sigma values
2062  integer, intent(in) :: ndir ! Number of directions
2063  integer, intent(in) :: ndepth ! Number of water depths
2064  real, intent(in) :: sigma(nsigma) ! Radian frequencies
2065  real, intent(in) :: dird(ndir) ! Directions (degrees)
2066  real, intent(in) :: pftail ! power of spectral tail, e.g. -4 or -5
2067  real, intent(in) :: depth(ndepth) ! depths for which integration space must be computed
2068  real, intent(in) :: x_grav ! gravitational acceleration
2069  integer, intent(in) :: jquad ! Type of method for computing nonlinear interactions
2070  integer, intent(in) :: iqgrid ! Type of grid for computing nonlinear interactions
2071 ! integer, intent(in) :: iproc ! Processor number, controls output file for MPI
2072  integer, intent(out) :: ierror ! Error indicator. If no errors are detected IERR=0
2073 !
2074 ! 4. Error messages
2075 !
2076 ! An error message is produced within the QUAD system.
2077 ! If no errors are detected IERROR=0
2078 ! otherwise IERROR > 0
2079 !
2080 ! ierr Description of error
2081 ! -------------------------------
2082 ! 1 Invalid value of iquad
2083 ! 2 Invalid value of iq_grid
2084 ! 31 Incompatability between iq_grid and input directions for circle grid
2085 ! 32 Incompatability between iq_grid and input directions for sector grid grid
2086 ! 4 Error in deleting *.ERR file
2087 ! 5 Error generated by Q_SETCONFIG
2088 ! 6 Error generated by Q_CHKCFG
2089 ! 7 Error generated by Q_CTRGRID
2090 !
2091 ! 5. Called by:
2092 !
2093 ! host program, e.g. SWANQUAD5
2094 !
2095 ! 6. Subroutines used:
2096 !
2097 ! Q_SETVERSION
2098 ! Q_SETCONFIG
2099 ! Q_CHKCFG
2100 ! Q_SUMMARY
2101 ! Q_ALLOCATE
2102 ! Q_CTRGRID
2103 ! Q_INIT
2104 !
2105 ! 7. Remarks
2106 !
2107 ! 8. Structure
2108 !
2109 ! 9. Switches
2110 !
2111 ! 10. Source code
2112 !---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2113 !
2114 ! Local parameters
2115 !
2116  integer iuerr ! error indicator
2117  integer idepth ! index over water depths
2118  integer igrid ! status of quadruplet grid file
2119  integer ia,ik ! counters
2120 !
2121  real depmin ! minimum water depth
2122  real dstep ! directional step
2123  real dgap ! directional gap between first and last direction
2124 !
2125  call q_setversion ! set version number
2126 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2127 ! user defined settings
2128 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2129 ! q_mindepth = 0.1 ! Set minimum water depth
2130  q_mindepth = trshdep ! Set minimum water depth (=DEPMIN)
2131  q_maxdepth = 2000 ! Set maximum water depth
2132  q_dstep = 0.1 ! Set minimum step for coding depth files
2133  iscreen = 6 ! Identifier for screen output (UNIX=0, WINDOWS=6)
2134  iufind = 1 ! search for unit numbers automatically
2135 !----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2136 ! Initialisations
2137 !
2138  ierror = 0 ! set error condition
2139  iq_stack = 0 ! initialize stack for tracing subroutines
2140  qbase = 'xnl4v5' ! Base name for quadruplet files
2141  qf_error = 'xnl5_errors.txt' ! Text file with error messages
2142  lastquadfile = 'quad?????.bqf' ! Initialize name of last retrieved quad file
2143 !
2144 ! set values of physical quantities
2145 ! and store them in quad data area
2146 !
2147  q_grav = x_grav ! gravitational acceleration
2148  qf_tail = pftail ! Power of parametric spectral tail
2149  iq_type = jquad ! Type of method to compute transfer
2150  iq_prt = 0 ! Print output on, to file /qbase/.prt
2151  iq_test = 0 ! test level
2152  iq_trace = 0 ! level of subroutine trace
2153  iq_log = 0 ! Set logging of q_routines off
2154  iq_grid = iqgrid ! Grid type for computation of nonlinear transfer
2155  iq_screen = 0 ! enable output to screen
2156 !
2157 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2158 ! Check input
2159 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2160  if(iq_type<1 .or. iq_type>3) then
2161  ierror = 1
2162  goto 9999
2163  end if
2164 !
2165  if(iq_grid<1 .or. iq_grid>3) then
2166  ierror = 2
2167  goto 9999
2168  end if
2169 !
2170 ! Retrieve size of spectral grid from input
2171 !
2172  fqmin = sigma(1)/(4.*pih) ! minimum frequency in Hz
2173  fqmax = sigma(nsigma)/(4.*pih) ! maximum frequency in Hz
2174  nkq = nsigma ! number of frequencies/wave numbers
2175  naq = ndir ! number of directions
2176 !
2177 ! check if directions are given on full circle or in a symmetric sector
2178 !----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2179 ! 1: compute directional step
2180 ! 2: compute gap between first and last
2181 ! 3: compare gap with step
2182 !
2183  dstep = dird(2)-dird(1) ! directional step
2184  dgap = 180.- abs(180.- abs(dird(1)-dird(ndir))) ! directional gap
2185 !
2186 !----------------------------------------------------------------------
2187  if(iq_grid==1 .or. iq_grid==2) then
2188 !
2189 ! check if gap equal to step in the case of full circle
2190 !
2191  if(abs(dstep-dgap) < 0.001) then
2192  ierror = 31
2193  write(iscreen,'(a,i4,2f10.2)') 'XNL_INIT iq_grid dstep dgap:', &
2194  iq_grid,dstep,dgap
2195  goto 9999
2196  end if
2197 !
2198 ! check if sector is symmetric around zero in the case of sector grid
2199 !
2200  if(abs(dird(1)+dird(ndir)) > 0.01) then
2201  write(iscreen,'(a,i4,2f10.2)') &
2202  'XNL_INIT iq_grid dird(1) dird(n):',iq_grid,dird(1),dird(ndir)
2203  ierror = 32
2204  goto 9999
2205  end if
2206  end if
2207 !
2208  q_dird1 = dird(1)
