9260 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
9261 !
9262 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
9263 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
9264 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
9265 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
9266 !
9267 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
9268 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
9269 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
9270 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
9271 !
9272 !
9273  implicit none
9274 !
9275 ! 0. Update history
9276 !
9277 ! 15/04/2002 Initial version
9278 ! 20/08/2002 Direction of k1 may be non-zero
9279 ! 27/08/2002 Singular solution crosses origin
9280 ! 11/06/2003 Length of locus fixed to 3
9281 !
9282 ! 1. Purpose:
9283 !
9284 ! Compute locus for the special case w1=w3
9285 !
9286 ! 2. Method
9287 !
9288 ! For this case, the k2-locus consists of a straight line
9289 !
9290 ! 3. Parameter used:
9291 !
9292  integer, intent(in) :: npts ! Number of points
9293  real, intent(in) :: k1x ! x-component of wave number k1
9294  real, intent(in) :: k1y ! y-component of wave number k1
9295  real, intent(in) :: k3x ! x-component of wave number k3
9296  real, intent(in) :: k3y ! y-component of wave number k3
9297 !
9298  real, intent(out) :: k2x(npts) ! x-component of wave number k2
9299  real, intent(out) :: k2y(npts) ! y-component of wave number k2
9300  real, intent(out) :: k4x(npts) ! x-component of wave number k4
9301  real, intent(out) :: k4y(npts) ! y-component of wave number k4
9302  real, intent(out) :: s(npts) ! distance along locus
9303 !
9304 ! 4. Error messages
9305 !
9306 ! 5. Caled by:
9307 !
9308 ! Q_CMPLOCUS
9309 !
9310 ! 6. Subroutines used
9311 !
9312 ! 7. Remarks
9313 !
9314 ! Routine based on modified version of routine SHLOCX of Resio and Tracy
9315 ! On 15/4/2002 a bug fixed in computation of THR when angle of k3 is larger than 90
9316 !
9317 ! In addition, the assumption that k1y=0 and thus dir1=0 is removed
9318 ! In bug fix of 20/8/2002 this restriction is removed.
9319 !
9320 ! 8. Structure
9321 !
9322 ! Compute angle of symmetry axis
9323 ! Compute distance between 2 lines of solution
9324 ! compute wave numbers along locus
9325 ! rotate angles
9326 !
9327 ! 9. Switches
9328 !
9329 ! 10. Source code
9330 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9331 ! Local variables
9332 !
9333  integer ipt ! counter of points along locus
9334 !
9335  real dirs ! angle of symmetry axis
9336  real dir1 ! direction of wave number k1
9337  real dir3 ! direction of wave number k3
9338  real dk0 ! step size along locus
9339  real xk0 ! x-component
9340  real yk0 ! y-component
9341  real w2 ! radian frequency
9342  real xx2,yy2 ! values along k2-locus
9343  real xx4,yy4 ! values along k4-locus
9344  real k1m ! magnitude of wave number k1
9345 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9346 !
9347 ! dirs is the angle of rotation from the x-axis to the "bisecting" angle
9348 !
9349  dir1 = atan2(k1y,k1x)
9350  dir3 = atan2(k3y,k3x)
9351  dirs = 0.5*(180-abs(180-abs(dir3-dir1)))
9352  k1m = sqrt(k1x**2 + k1y**2)
9353 !
9354 ! k1x is the total length of the wavenumber vector
9355 ! xk0 is the length of this vector in the rotated coordinate system
9356 !
9357  xk0 = k1m * cos(dirs)
9358  yk0 = k1m * sin(dirs)
9359 !
9360 ! Specify step size for solution of singular case
9361 !
9362 !! dk0 = 0.11 ! Removed on 11/6/2003, this value is used in original WRT code
9363 !! dk0 = kqmax/real(npts-1.) this value depends on actual grid
9364  dk0 = 3./real(npts-1.) ! this is test value
9365 !
9366 ! modify rotation angle
9367 !
9368  dirs = dirs + dir1
9369 !
9370 ! generate sequence of parallel lines
9371 ! rotate lines over modified angle DIRS
9372 !
9373  do ipt=1,npts
9374 ! w2 = real(ipt-1.)*dk0 ! removed on Aug. 27 2002
9375 !
9376  w2 = 2.*real(ipt-npts/2)*dk0 ! create line on both sides of origin
9377  xx2 = w2*xk0
9378  yy2 = yk0
9379  k2x(ipt) = xx2*cos(dirs) - yy2*sin(dirs)
9380  k2y(ipt) = yy2*cos(dirs) + xx2*sin(dirs)
9381  xx4 = xx2
9382  yy4 = -yy2
9383  k4x(ipt) = xx4*cos(dirs) - yy4*sin(dirs)
9384  k4y(ipt) = yy4*cos(dirs) + xx4*sin(dirs)
9385  s(ipt) = real(ipt-1)*dk0*xk0
9386  end do
9387 !
9388  return
9389  end subroutine
9390 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9391  subroutine q_xnl4v4(aspec,sigma,angle,nsig,nang,depth,xnl,diag, &
9392  ierror)
9393 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9394 !
9395 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
9396 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
9397 ! | +---+
9398 ! | | +---+ Last update: 29 April 2004
9399 ! +---+ | | Release: 5.0
9400 ! +---+
9401 !
9402 !
9403 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
9404 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
9405 !
9406 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
9407 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
9408 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
9409 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
9410 !
9411 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
9412 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
9413 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
9414 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
9415 !
9416 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
9417 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
9418 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
9419 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
9420 !
9421 !
9422 ! do not use m_xnldata
9423  use m_constants
9424  use serv_xnl4v5
9425  implicit none
9426 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9427 ! 0. Update history
9428 !
9429 ! 08/01/2000 Initial version
9430 ! 12/01/2001 Updated interface
9431 ! 13/01/2001 Inclusion of diagonal term
9432 ! 14/02/2002 Upgrade to release 4.0, depth added to input
9433 ! 20/08/2002 quad depth adapted in the case of WAM-depth scaling
9434 ! then deep water is assumed for conversion of A(sig,theta) -> N(kx,ky)
9435 ! Search option for nearest grid included
9436 ! 23/08/2002 Allocation of work arrays set to fixed size
9437 ! 11/09/2002 Filtering of energy densities introduced and restructure
9438 ! 14/04/2003 Format of test write statement corrected
9439 ! 03/05/2003 Computation and output of triplets enabled
9440 ! 12/06/2003 Export spectral grid in case of Q_INTEG>1
9441 ! 16/06/2003 Switch IQ_SYM included
9442 ! Allocation of dynamic data array's moved to Q_ALLOCATE
9443 ! 24/06/2003 Range of loop for IK3 made dependent on value of IQ_SYM
9444 ! 25/06/2003 Bug fixed in assigment of contribution of diagonal term
9445 ! 27/04/2004 Bug fixed in hadling of symmetric sector grid
9446 ! Also mirror image of DIAG copied after computation
9447 ! 29/04/2004 In case of error set variable IERROR
9448 !
9449 ! 1. Purpose:
9450 !
9451 ! Compute nonlinear transfer for a given action density spectrum
9452 ! on a given wave number and direction grid
9453 !
9454 ! 2. Method
9455 !
9456 ! Compute nonlinear transfer in a surface gravity wave spectrum
9457 ! due to resonant four wave-wave interactions
9458 !
9459 ! Methods: Webb/Resio/Tracy/VanVledder
9460 !
9461 !
9462 ! 3. Parameter list:
9463 !
9464 ! Type I/O Name Description
9465 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9466  integer,intent(in) :: nsig ! number of radian frequencies
9467  integer,intent(in) :: nang ! number of directions
9468  real, intent(in) :: aspec(nsig,nang) ! Action density spectrum as a function of (sigma,theta)
9469  real, intent(in) :: sigma(nsig) ! radian frequencies
9470  real, intent(in) :: angle(nang) ! directions in radians (sector or full circle)
9471  real, intent(in) :: depth ! water depth in m
9472  real, intent(out) :: xnl(nsig,nang) ! nonlinear quadruplet interaction computed with
9473 ! a certain exact method (k,theta)
9474  real, intent(out) :: diag(nsig,nang) ! Diagonal term for WAM based implicit integration scheme
9475  integer, intent(out) :: ierror ! error indicator
9476 !
9477 ! 4. Error messages
9478 !
9479 ! 5. Called by:
9480 !
9481 ! XNL_MAIN
9482 !
9483 ! 6. Subroutines used
9484 !
9485 ! Q_STACK
9486 ! Q_INIT
9487 ! Q_CTRGRID
9488 ! Q_T13V4
9489 ! Q_SEARCHGRID
9490 !
9491 ! 7. Remarks
9492 !
9493 ! The external action density spectrum is given as N(sigma,dir)
9494 ! The internal action density spectrum is given as N(kx,ky)
9495 !
9496 ! These 2 spectra are conected via the Jacobian transformation
9497 !
9498 ! cg
9499 ! N(kx,ky) = -- N(sig,theta)
9500 ! k
9501 ! 8. Structure
9502 !
9503 ! 9. Switches
9504 !
9505 ! 10. Source code
9506 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9507 ! local variables
9508 !---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9509  integer iaq ! counter for directions
9510  integer jaq ! counter for directions
9511  integer ikq ! counter for wave numbers
9512  integer iang ! counter for directions
9513  integer ia ! counter for directions
9514  integer ik ! counter for wave numbers
9515  integer idir1 ! direction in degrees of k1 (for integration test)
9516  integer idir3 ! direction in degrees of k3 (for integration test)
9517  real period ! periodicity for direction, used in conversion of 2-spectra
9518  real diagk1 ! diagonal term for k1
9519  real diagk3 ! diagonal term for k3
9520 !
9521  real qn_max ! maximum action density
9522  real qn_min ! minimum action density
9523 !
9524  real cg(nsig) ! group velocity for conversion of spectrum and transfer
9525 !
9526  integer ia1,ia3,ja3 ! limits for directional loops
9527  integer jk3 ! start of k3 loop
9528  integer ik1,ik3 ! counters for wave number loop
9529  integer nloc ! number of points on locus
9530 !
9531  integer igrid ! status of grid file
9532  real t13 ! value of sub-integral
9533  real k_rat ! local ratio of wave numbers
9534  real a_dif ! directional difference
9535  real jacobian ! Jacobian
9536  real qn1,qn3 ! action densities in k1 and k3
9537 !
9538 ! testing of diagonal term on a low level
9539 !
9540  real diagk1_0 ! saved value of diagk1
9541  real diagk3_0 ! saved value of diagk3
9542  real dq1 ! small change in action density of n1
9543  real dq3 ! small change in action density of n3
9544  real t13_0 ! Original estimated of diagonal term
9545  real t13_1,t13_3 ! perturbed estimated of diagonal term
9546 !
9547  integer ifil_dir ! indicator for filtering of directional criterion
9548  integer ifil_krat ! indicator for filtering of wave number ratio criterion
9549  integer ifil_dens ! indicator for filtering of action density criterion
9550  integer ifil_tot ! indicator for filtering due to any criterion
9551  integer nfil_dir ! counter to indicate filtering of directional criterion
9552  integer nfil_krat ! counter to indicate filtering of wave number criterion
9553  integer nfil_dens ! counter to indicate filtering of action density criterion
9554 !
9555  integer ntot_conf ! total number of configurations
9556  integer ntot_filt ! total number of filtered configurations
9557 !
9558  integer icx1,icx3 ! test output for T13 test
9559  real xt13 ! modified contribution of T13
9560 !
9561 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9562  call q_stack('+q_xnl4v4')
9563 !
9564 ! initialisations
9565 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9566  ierror = 0 ! error status
9567  diag = 0 ! initialize output diagonal term
9568 !
9569 !
9570  if(iq_type==3) then
9571  q_depth = depth ! water depth to be used in computation
9572  else
9573  q_depth = q_maxdepth
9574  end if
9575 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
9576 ! generate basic grid of loci and store loci in memory and to datafile
9577 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
9578  if(iq_screen >= 1) write(iscreen,'(a)') &
9579  'Q_XNL4V4: Checking interaction grid '
9580  if(iq_screen >= 1) write(iscreen,'(a,2i4)') &
9581  'Q_XNL4V4: iq_search iq_type:',iq_search,iq_type
9582 !
9583  if(iq_search==0 .or. iq_type/=3) then
9584  call q_init
9585  call q_ctrgrid(2,igrid)
9586  if(iq_err /= 0) then
9587  ierror = 1
9588  goto 9999
9589  end if
9590 !
9591  if(igrid/=0) then
9592  call q_error('e','NOGRID','No proper grid exists')
9593  ierror = 2
9594  goto 9999
9595  end if
9596 !
9597  if(iq_make ==3) then
9598  call q_error('e','MAKEGRID','Only computation of grid')
9599  goto 9999
9600  end if
9601 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9602 ! set overall scale factor resulting from optional SEARCH for nearest grid
9603 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9604 !
9605  q_scale = 1.
9606 !------------------------------------------------------------------------
9607  else
9608 !
9609 ! search nearest valid grid and compute additional WAM scale factor
9610 ! only active when IQ_SEARCH==1 .AND. IQ_TYPE==3
9611 !
9612  if(iq_screen>0) write(iscreen,'(a,f12.2)') &
9613  'Q_XNL4V4: Q_SEARCHGRID called with q_depth: ',q_depth
9614  call q_searchgrid(depth,igrid)
9615 
9616  if(iq_screen>0) write(iscreen,'(a,f12.2)') &
9617  'Q_XNL4V4: Q_SEARCHGRID exited with q_depth: ',q_depth
9618 
9619  if(igrid/=0) then
9620  call q_error('e','NOGRID','No proper grid exists')
9621  ierror = 3
9622  goto 9999
9623  end if
9624 !
9625  if(iq_err /=0) goto 9999
9626  end if
9627 !
9628 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9629 ! convert input action density spectrum from A(sigma,theta) -> N(kx,ky)
9630 !
9631  do ikq=1,nkq
9632  call z_cmpcg(sigma(ikq),q_depth,q_grav,cg(ikq))
9633  do iaq=1,naq
9634  nspec(ikq,iaq) = aspec(ikq,iaq)/q_k(ikq)*cg(ikq)
9635  end do
9636  end do
9637 !
9638  if(iq_test>=1) then
9639  write(luq_tst,'(a)') 'NSPEC'
9640  do ikq=1,nkq
9641  write(luq_tst,'(100e12.4)') (nspec(ikq,iaq),iaq=1,naq)
9642  end do
9643  end if
9644 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9645 !
9646  if(iq_integ==2) then
9647  write(luq_int,'(2i4)') nkq,naq
9648  write(luq_int,'(10f10.3)') (q_k(ik1),ik1=1,nkq)
9649  write(luq_int,'(10f10.3)') (q_a(ia1)*rade,ia1=1,naq)
9650  end if
9651 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9652 ! integration over all possible configurations
9653 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9654  xnl = 0.
9655  qn_max = maxval(nspec)
9656 !
9657 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9658  do ik1 = 1,nkq
9659  if(iq_screen >= 1) write(iscreen,'(a,2i4,e12.3)') &
9660  'Q_XNL4V4: k1 nk depth:',ik1,nkq,q_depth
9661  jk3 = ik1
9662  if(iq_sym==0) jk3 = 1
9663 !
9664  do ia1 = iaq1,iaq2 ! loop over selected part of grid, set in q_init
9665 !
9666  qn1 = nspec(ik1,ia1)
9667 !
9668  do ik3 = jk3,nkq ! compute only half-plane
9669  do ia3 = 1,naq ! loop over all possible wave directions
9670  qn3 = nspec(ik3,ia3)
9671 !
9672  if(iq_screen>=3) write(iscreen,'(a,4i4)') &
9673  'Q_XNL4V4: ik1 ia1 ik3 ia3:',ik1,ia1,ik3,ia3
9674 !
9675 ! computes distances in wave number space
9676 !
9677  a_dif = 180. - abs(180. - abs(q_ad(ia1) - q_ad(ia3)))
9678  k_rat = max(q_k(ik1)/q_k(ik3), q_k(ik3)/q_k(ik1))
9679  qn_min = qf_frac*qn_max/(q_k(ik3)/q_k(1))**7.5
9680  qn_min = qf_frac*qn_max*q_kpow(ik3)
9681 !
9682  ifil_dir = 0
9683  ifil_krat = 0
9684  ifil_dens = 0
9685  ifil_tot = 0
9686 !
9687 ! perform filtering
9688 !
9689 ! directional difference
9690 !
9691  if(a_dif > qf_dmax) then
9692  ifil_dir = 1
9693  end if
9694 !
9695 ! wave number ratio
9696 !
9697  if(k_rat > qf_krat) then
9698  ifil_krat = 1
9699  end if
9700 !
9701 ! energy density filtering
9702 !
9703  if(qn1 < qn_min .and. qn3 < qn_min) then
9704  ifil_dens = 1
9705  end if
9706 !
9707 !
9708  if(ifil_dir==0 .and. ifil_krat==0 .and. ifil_dens==0 .or. &
9709  iq_filt==0) then
9710 !? if(a_dif < qf_dmax .and. k_rat < qf_krat .or. iq_filt==0) then
9711 !
9712 ! perform integration along locus
9713 !
9714  call q_t13v4(ik1,ia1,ik3,ia3,t13,diagk1,diagk3)
9715 !
9716 ! check computation of diagonal term --------------------------------------
9717 ! check has been done on 25 June 2003
9718 !
9719 ! diagk1_0 = diagk1
9720 ! diagk3_0 = diagk3
9721 ! t13_0 = t13
9722 ! t13_1 = 0.
9723 ! t13_3 = 0.
9724 ! dq1 = nspec(ik1,ia1)*0.01
9725 ! dq3 = nspec(ik3,ia3)*0.01
9726 ! nspec(ik1,ia1) = nspec(ik1,ia1)+ dq1
9727 ! call q_t13v4(ik1,ia1,ik3,ia3,t13,diagk1,diagk3)
9728 ! if(dq1>1.e-10) t13_1 = (t13-t13_0)/dq1
9729 ! nspec(ik1,ia1) = nspec(ik1,ia1) - dq1
9730 !
9731 ! nspec(ik3,ia3) = nspec(ik3,ia3) + dq3
9732 ! call q_t13v4(ik1,ia1,ik3,ia3,t13,diagk1,diagk3)
9733 ! nspec(ik3,ia3) = nspec(ik3,ia3) - dq3
9734 ! if(dq3>1.e-10) t13_3 = (t13-t13_0)/dq3
9735 ! write(*,'(a,6e13.4)') 'Check of diagonal term:',dq1,diagk1_0,t13_1,dq3,diagk3_0,t13_3
9736 !
9737 !---------- end of check of diagonal term
9738 !
9739  if(iq_err /= 0) then
9740  ierror = 4
9741  goto 9999
9742  end if
9743 !
9744 ! check contribution T13 as computed with triplet method
9745 !
9746 !!/R qt13 = 0.
9747 !!/R do iqtr = 1,ktriplets
9748 !!/R qt13 = qt13 + w_qtr(iqtr)*nspec(i_qtr(iqtr,1),i_qtr(iqtr,2))*
9749 !!/R & nspec(i_qtr(iqtr,3),i_qtr(iqtr,4))*nspec(i_qtr(iqtr,5),i_qtr(iqtr,6))
9750 !!/R end do
9751 !!/R write(iscreen,*) 'CHECK T13 QT13:',t13,qt13
9752 !
9753  if(iq_t13==1) then
9754  idir1 = int(q_ad(ia1))
9755  idir3 = int(q_ad(ia3))
9756  if (idir1>180) idir1 = idir1-360
9757  if (idir3>180) idir3 = idir3-360
9758  icx1 = (idir1/15-1)*20+ik1
9759  icx3 = (idir3/15-1)*20+ik3
9760  xt13 = alog10(max(1.e-20,abs(t13)))
9761  if(xt13<-19.99) xt13=0
9762  write(luq_t13,'(4i6,e13.5,2i6,f10.4)') ik1,idir1,ik3, &
9763  idir3,t13,icx1,icx3,xt13
9764  end if
9765 !
9766 ! take care of additional scale factor aring from search of nearest grid
9767 !
9768  t13 = t13*q_scale
9769  diagk1 = diagk1*q_scale
9770  diagk3 = diagk3*q_scale
9771 !
9772 ! take care of symmetric storing of interactions
9773 ! and factor 2 due to symmetry (if activated)
9774 !
9775  if(iq_sym==1) then
9776  t13 = 2.*t13
9777  diagk1 = 2.*diagk1
9778  diagk3 = 2.*diagk3
9779  end if
9780 !
9781 ! compute mirror image of index
9782 !
9783  ja3 = ia3
9784  if(iq_grid==1 .and. ia3 < iaref) ja3 = naq-ia3+1
9785 !
9786  xnl(ik1,ia1) = xnl(ik1,ia1) + t13*q_k(ik3)* &
9787  q_delta*q_dk(ik3)
9788  xnl(ik3,ja3) = xnl(ik3,ja3) - t13*q_k(ik1)* &
9789  q_delta*q_dk(ik1)
9790 !
9791 ! add diagonal term
9792 !
9793  diag(ik1,ia1) = diag(ik1,ia1) + diagk1*q_k(ik3)* &
9794  q_delta*q_dk(ik3)
9795  diag(ik3,ja3) = diag(ik3,ja3) - diagk3*q_k(ik1)* &
9796  q_delta*q_dk(ik1)
9797 !
9798  end if
9799 !
9800 !!/F write(luq_fil,'(a,4i3,3e11.3,2f7.2,4i2)')
9801 !!/F & 'ik1 ia1 ik3 ia3 n1 n3 t13 adif krat fil1/2/3:',
9802 !!/F & ik1,ia1,ik3,ia3,qn1,qn3,t13,a_dif,k_rat,
9803 !!/F & ifil_dir,ifil_krat,ifil_dens,ifil_tot
9804  end do
9805  end do
9806  end do
9807  end do
9808 !
9809 !
9810 !
9811 !
9812 !
9813 ! write number of triplets that have been written
9814 !
9815 !
9816 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9817 ! in the case of a symmetric sector, copy results to other part
9818 !
9819 ! Examples: naq=5, iaref=3: 1,2,3,4,5 -> Q(1)=Q(5)
9820 ! Q(2)=Q(4)
9821 ! Q(3)=Q(3)
9822 ! iaq+jaq=naq+1
9823 ! naq=6, iaref=4: 1,2,3,4,5,6 -> Q(1)=Q(6)
9824 ! Q(2)=Q(5)
9825 ! Q(3)=Q(4)
9826 !
9827  if(iq_grid==1) then
9828  do ikq = 1,nkq
9829  do iaq=iaref,naq
9830  jaq = naq+1-iaq
9831  xnl(ikq,jaq) = xnl(ikq,iaq)
9832  diag(ikq,jaq) = diag(ikq,iaq)
9833  end do
9834  end do
9835  end if
9836 !
9837 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9838  if(iq_screen>=2) write(iscreen,'(a)') &
9839  'Q_XNL4V4: Main computation ended'
9840 !
9841 ! Convert transfer from (kx,ky) grid to (sigma,theta) grid
9842 !
9843  do ikq=1,nkq
9844  jacobian = q_k(ikq)/cg(ikq)
9845  do iaq=1,naq
9846  xnl(ikq,iaq) = xnl(ikq,iaq)*jacobian
9847  end do
9848  end do
9849 ! !
9850  9999 continue
9851 !
9852  call q_stack('-q_xnl4v4')
9853 !
9854  return
9855  end subroutine
9856 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9857  real function x_cosk(k)
9858 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9859 !
9860 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
9861 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
9862 ! | +---+
9863 ! | | +---+ Last update: 13 Aug. 2002
9864 ! +---+ | | Release: 4.0
9865 ! +---+
9866 !
9867 !
9868 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
9869 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
9870 !
9871 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
9872 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
9873 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
9874 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
9875 !
9876 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
9877 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
9878 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
9879 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
9880 !
9881 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
9882 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
9883 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
9884 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
9885 !
9886 !
9887 ! do not use m_xnldata
9888  use serv_xnl4v5, only: z_wnumb
9889 !
9890  implicit none
9891 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9892 ! 0. Update history
9893 !
9894 ! Date Description
9895 !
9896 ! 13/08/2002 Initial version
9897 !
9898 ! 1. Purpose:
9899 !
9900 ! Compute cosine of points on locus for given wave number k
9901 !
9902 ! 2. Method
9903 !
9904 ! Explicit polar method, see Van Vledder 2000, Monterey paper
9905 ! Optionally using a fixed k-step, geometric k-step or adaptive stepping
9906 !
9907 ! 3. Parameters used:
9908 !
9909  real, intent(in) :: k ! wave number along symmetry axis of locus
9910 !
9911 ! 4. Error messages
9912 !
9913 ! 5. Called by:
9914 !
9915 ! Q_POLAR
9916 !
9917 ! 6. Subroutines used:
9918 !
9919 ! Z_WNUMB computation of wave number
9920 !
9921 ! 7. Remarks
9922 !
9923 ! The variables q, pmag and q_depth are accessed from module m_xnldata
9924 ! The variable q_grav is accessed from module m_constants
9925 !
9926 ! 8. Structure
9927 !
9928 ! 9. Switches
9929 !
9930 !
9931 ! 10. Source code
9932 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9933 ! Local variables
9934 !
9935  real qq ! constant in direct polar method qq=q/sqrt(g)
9936  real wk ! intemediate radian frequency
9937  real kz ! intermediate wave number
9938 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9939  select case(iq_disp)
9940 !
9941  case(1) ! deep water
9942 !
9943  qq = q/sqrt(q_grav)
9944  x_cosk = ((qq+sqrt(k))**4 - k**2 - pmag**2)/(2.*k*pmag)
9945 !
9946  case(2) ! finite depth
9947 !
9948  wk = q + x_disper(k,q_depth)
9949  kz = z_wnumb(wk,q_depth,q_grav)
9950  x_cosk = (kz**2-k**2 - pmag**2)/(2.*k*pmag)
9951 !
9952  end select
9953 !
9954  x_cosk = max(-1.,x_cosk)
9955  x_cosk = min( 1.,x_cosk)
9956 !
9957  end function x_cosk
9958 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9959  real function x_cple(k1x,k1y,k2x,k2y,k3x,k3y,k4x,k4y,iq_cple, &
9960  depth,grav_w)
9961 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9962 !
9963 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
9964 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
9965 ! | +---+
9966 ! | | +---+ Last update: 10 Sept. 2002
9967 ! +---+ | | Release: 5.0
9968 ! +---+
9969 !
9970 !
9971 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
9972 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
9973 !
9974 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
9975 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
9976 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
9977 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
9978 !
9979 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
9980 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
9981 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
9982 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
9983 !
9984 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
9985 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
9986 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
9987 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
9988 !
9989 !
9990  implicit none
9991 !
9992 ! 0. Update history
9993 !
9994 ! 25/02/1999 Initial version
9995 ! 25/10/1999 Names of some variables modified
9996 ! type and depth via interface
9997 ! 09/08/2002 Upgrade to release 4.0
9998 ! 10/09/2002 g included in interface
9999 !
10000 ! 1. Purpose:
10001 !
10002 ! Compute coupling coefficient between a quadruplet of
10003 ! interacting wave numbers
10004 !
10005 ! 2. Method
10006 !
10007 !
10008 ! 3. Parameter list:
10009 !
10010 ! Name I/O Type Description
10011 !
10012 !Type I/O Name Description
10013 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10014  real, intent(in) :: k1x ! x-component of wave number k1
10015  real, intent(in) :: k1y ! y-component of wave number k1
10016  real, intent(in) :: k2x ! x-component of wave number k2
10017  real, intent(in) :: k2y ! y-component of wave number k2
10018  real, intent(in) :: k3x ! x-component of wave number k3
10019  real, intent(in) :: k3y ! y-component of wave number k3
10020  real, intent(in) :: k4x ! x-component of wave number k4
10021  real, intent(in) :: k4y ! y-component of wave number k4
10022  integer, intent(in) :: iq_cple ! Type of coupling coefficient
10023  real, intent(in) :: depth ! Water depth in meters
10024  real, intent(in) :: grav_w ! Gravitational acceleration
10025 !
10026 ! 4. Error messages
10027 !
10028 ! 5. Called by:
10029 !
10030 ! Q_CMPLOCUS
10031 !
10032 ! 6. Subroutines used
10033 !
10034 ! X_WEBB
10035 ! X_HH
10036 !
10037 ! 7. Remarks
10038 !
10039 ! 8. Structure
10040 !
10041 ! 9. Switches
10042 !
10043 ! 10. Source code:
10044 !-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10045 ! Local variables
10046 ! ! real functions to compute coupling coefficient
10047 !!real xc_webb ! Webb, deep water
10048 !!real xc_hh ! Herterich and Hasselmann, finite depth
10049 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10050  if (iq_cple < 1 .or. iq_cple > 4) then
10051  x_cple = 0.
10052  goto 9999
10053  end if
10054 !
10055  select case(iq_cple)
10056 !
10057 ! 1) Deep water coupling coefficient of Webb
10058 !
10059  case(1)
10060  x_cple = xc_webb(k1x,k1y,k2x,k2y,k3x,k3y,k4x,k4y,grav_w)
10061 !
10062 ! 2) finite depth coupling coefficient of Herterich and Hasselmann
10063 ! as implemented in the Resio-Tracy program SB5
10064 !
10065  case(2)
10066  x_cple = xc_hh(k4x,k4y,k3x,k3y,k2x,k2y,k1x,k1y,depth)
10067 !
10068 ! x_cple = xc_hh2(k1x,k1y,k2x,k2y,k3x,k3y,depth,grav_w)
10069 !
10070  end select
10071 !
10072  9999 continue
10073 !
10074  return
10075  end function
10076 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10077  real function x_flocus(kxx,kyy)
10078 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10079 !
10080 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
10081 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
10082 ! | +---+
10083 ! | | +---+ Last update: 9 Aug. 2002
10084 ! +---+ | | Release: 4.0
10085 ! +---+
10086 !
10087 !
10088 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
10089 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
10090 !
10091 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
10092 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
10093 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
10094 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
10095 !
10096 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
10097 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
10098 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
10099 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
10100 !
10101 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
10102 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
10103 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
10104 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
10105 !
10106 !
10107 ! do not use m_xnldata
10108  use m_constants
10109  implicit none
10110 !
10111 ! 0. Update history
10112 !
10113 ! 25/02/1999 Initial version
10114 ! 20/07/1999 Bug fixed when IDISP=2
10115 ! 09/10/1999 Values of w2 and w4 in double precision
10116 ! to improve accuracy of computation of z
10117 ! 09/08/2002 Upgrade to release 4.0
10118 !
10119 ! 1. Purpose:
10120 !
10121 ! Compute locus function used for the determination of the
10122 ! resonance condition
10123 !
10124 ! 2. Method
10125 !
10126 ! Explicit function evaluation
10127 !
10128 ! 3. Parameter list:
10129 !
10130 !Type I/O Name Description
10131 !-----------------------------------------------------------
10132  real, intent(in) :: kxx ! x-component of wave number
10133  real, intent(in) :: kyy ! y-component of wave number
10134 !
10135 ! 4. Error messages
10136 !
10137 !
10138 ! 5. Called by:
10139 !
10140 ! Q_LOCPOS
10141 !
10142 ! 6. Subroutines used
10143 !
10144 ! X_DISPER
10145 !
10146 ! 7. Remarks
10147 !
10148 ! if iq_disp not valid, then q_disper = -1
10149 !
10150 ! 8. Structure
10151 !
10152 ! 9. Switches
10153 !
10154 ! 10. Source code:
10155 !-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10156 ! Local variables
10157 !
10158  real z ! diferrence
10159  real k2m,k4m ! wave number magnitudes
10160  real (kind=8) w2,w4 ! radian frequencies
10161 !! real x_disper
10162 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10163 ! call q_stack('+x_flocus')
10164 !
10165  select case(iq_disp)
10166  case (1)
10167  w2 = sqrtg * (kxx**2 + kyy**2)**(0.25)
10168  w4 = sqrtg * ((kxx+px)**2 + (kyy+py)**2)**(0.25)
10169  z = q + w2 - w4
10170 !
10171  case (2)
10172  k2m = sqrt(kxx**2+kyy**2)
10173  k4m = sqrt((kxx+px)**2 + (kyy+py)**2)
10174  w2 = x_disper(k2m,q_depth)
10175  w4 = x_disper(k4m,q_depth)
10176  z = q + w2 - w4
10177 !
10178  case default
10179  z = -1
10180  end select
10181 !
10182  x_flocus = z
10183 !
10184 !call q_stack('-x_flocus')
10185 !
10186  return
10187  end function
10188 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10189  real function x_jacobian(x2,y2,x4,y4)
10190 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10191 !
10192 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
10193 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
10194 ! | +---+
10195 ! | | +---+ Last update: 9 Aug. 2002
10196 ! +---+ | | Release: 4.0
10197 ! +---+
10198 !
10199 !
10200 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
10201 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
10202 !
10203 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
10204 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
10205 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
10206 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
10207 !
10208 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
10209 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
10210 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
10211 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
10212 !
10213 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
10214 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
10215 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
10216 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
10217 !
10218 !
10219 ! do not use m_xnldata
10220 !% use serv_xnl4v5, only: z_cmpcg
10221 !
10222  implicit none
10223 !
10224 ! 0. Update history
10225 !
10226 ! 25/02/1999 Initial version
10227 ! 12/10/1999 Overflow avoided by checking for argument k*d
10228 ! 29/10/1999 Bug fixed in computing finite depth gradient
10229 ! 27/12/1999 Factor SQRT(Grav) added
10230 ! 01/10/2001 Components of k4 wave number explicitly input
10231 ! New version of function X_GRAD
10232 ! 09/08/2002 Computation of Jacobian replace by |cg2-cg4|
10233 ! based on old routine X_GRAD2
10234 ! Upgrade to release 4.0
10235 !
10236 ! 1. Purpose:
10237 !
10238 ! Compute gradient/Jacobian term for a given point on the locus
10239 !
10240 ! 2. Method
10241 !
10242 ! Explicit expressions for gradient term
10243 ! Using expression of Rasmussen (1998)
10244 ! J = |cg2-cg4|
10245 !
10246 ! 3. Parameter list:
10247 !
10248 ! Type I/O Name Description
10249 !--------------------------------------------------------------------
10250  real, intent(in) :: x2 ! x-component of wave number k2
10251  real, intent(in) :: y2 ! y-component of wave number k2
10252  real, intent(in) :: x4 ! x-component of wave number k4
10253  real, intent(in) :: y4 ! y-component of wave number k4
10254 !
10255 ! 4. Error messages
10256 !
10257 ! 5. Called by:
10258 !
10259 ! Q_CMPLOCUS
10260 !
10261 ! 6. Subroutines used:
10262 !
10263 ! 7. Remarks
10264 !
10265 ! 8. Structure
10266 !
10267 ! 9. Switches
10268 !
10269 ! 10. Source code:
10270 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10271 ! local variables
10272 !
10273  real k2m,k4m ! wave number magnitudes
10274  real k2md,k4md ! k*d values
10275  real ang2,ang4 ! directions
10276  real cg2,cg4 ! group velocities
10277  real sig2,sig4 ! radian frequencies
10278 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10279  k2m = sqrt(x2**2 + y2**2)
10280  k4m = sqrt(x4**2 + y4**2)
10281 !
10282  ang2 = atan2(x2,y2)
10283  ang4 = atan2(x4,y4)
10284 !
10285  sig2 = sqrt(q_grav*k2m*tanh(k2m*q_depth))
10286  sig4 = sqrt(q_grav*k4m*tanh(k4m*q_depth))
10287 !
10288  k2md = k2m*q_depth
10289  k4md = k4m*q_depth
10290 !
10291  if(k2md > 20) then
10292  cg2 = 0.5*q_grav/sig2
10293  else
10294  cg2 = sig2/k2m*(0.5+k2md/sinh(2*k2md))
10295  end if
10296 !
10297  if(k4md > 20) then
10298  cg4 = 0.5*q_grav/sig4
10299  else
10300  cg4 = sig4/k4m*(0.5+k4md/sinh(2*k4md))
10301  end if
10302 !
10303  x_jacobian = sqrt(cg2**2+cg4**2-2*cg2*cg4*cos(ang2-ang4))
10304 !
10305  return
10306  end function
10307 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10308  real function x_disper(k,d)
10309 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10310 !
10311 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
10312 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
10313 ! | +---+
10314 ! | | +---+ Last update: 9 Aug. 2002
10315 ! +---+ | | Release: 4.0
10316 ! +---+
10317 !
10318 !
10319 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
10320 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
10321 !
10322 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
10323 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
10324 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
10325 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
10326 !
10327 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
10328 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
10329 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
10330 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
10331 !
10332 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
10333 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
10334 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
10335 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
10336 !
10337 !
10338 ! do not use m_xnldata
10339  implicit none
10340 !
10341 ! 0. Update history
10342 !
10343 ! 16/02/1999 Initial version
10344 ! 25/02/1999 Short cut if kd > 10
10345 ! 09/08/2002 Upgrade to release 4.0
10346 !
10347 ! 1. Purpose:
10348 !
10349 ! Compute radian frequency for a given wave number and water depth
10350 !
10351 ! 2. Method
10352 !
10353 ! Depending on the value of the parameter iq_disp the radian
10354 ! wave number is computed as:
10355 ! 1) deep water
10356 ! 2) finite depth linear dispersion relation
10357 ! 3) finited depth non-linear dispersion relation (NOT YET implemented)
10358 !
10359 ! 3. Parameter list:
10360 !
10361 ! Type I/O Name Description
10362 !----------------------------------------------------------------------
10363  real, intent(in) :: k ! wave number
10364  real, intent(in) :: d ! water depth in m
10365 !
10366 ! 4. Error messages
10367 !
10368 ! if iq_type not valid, then q_disper = -1
10369 !
10370 ! 5. Called by:
10371 !
10372 ! Q_CHKRES
10373 !
10374 ! 6. Subroutines used
10375 !
10376 !
10377 ! 7. Remarks
10378 !
10379 ! Type of dispersion relation is determined by the parameter IQ_DISP:
10380 !
10381 ! IQ_DISP==1 deep water linear disperion relation is used
10382 ! 2 finite depth linear dispersion relation is used
10383 !
10384 ! 8. Structure
10385 !
10386 ! 9. Switches
10387 !
10388 ! 10. Source code
10389 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10390 ! Local variables
10391 !
10392  integer id ! copy of iq_type
10393  real kd ! k*d
10394 !
10395  kd = k * d
10396  id = iq_disp
10397 !
10398  if (kd > 20.) id = 1
10399 !
10400  select case(id)
10401  case (1) ! deep water w^2=g k
10402  x_disper = sqrt(q_grav*k)
10403  case (2) ! finite depth w^2 = g k tanh(k d)
10404  x_disper = sqrt(q_grav*k*tanh(k*d))
10405  case default
10406  x_disper = -1.
10407  end select
10408 !
10409  return
10410  end function
10411 
10412 ! real function x_locus1 moved to before subroutine q_locpos because of compilation problems
10413 ! real function x_locus2 moved to before subroutine q_locpos because of compilation problems
10414 
10415 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10416  real function xc_hh(w1x0,w1y0,w2x0,w2y0,w3x0,w3y0,z4x,z4y,h)
10417 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10418 !
10419 ! factor EPS included
10420 !
10421  implicit none
10422 !
10423  real z4x,z4y ! dummy arguments
10424 !
10425  real w1x0,w1y0,w2x0,w2y0,w3x0,w3y0,h,dsq
10426  real om1,om2,om3,om4,scpl1,scpl2,scpl3,stot
10427  real t1,t2,t3,t4,t5,tot1,tot2,tot3,tot4,tot5
10428  real som1,som2,som3
10429  real s1,s2,s3,z1,z2,z3,z4,z5
10430  real p1,p2,p3,p4,di,tnz1,tnz2,tnz3,tnz23
10431  real csz1,csz2,csz3,csz23
10432  real e,g,gsq,omsq23,pi4
10433  real dot123,dot23
10434 !! real cosz,tanz
10435 !
10436  real eps
10437 !
10438 
10439 ! calculates coupling coefficient in shallow water given k1,k2,k3
10440  real k1,k2,k3,k1x,k2x,k3x,k1y,k2y,k3y,k23x,k23y,k23,k1x0,k1y0, &
10441  k2x0,k2y0,k3x0,k3y0,k1zx,k1zy
10442  data pi4/0.785398163/
10443 !
10444  eps = 1.e-20
10445  g = 9.81
10446 !
10447  z4x = z4x
10448  z4y = z4y
10449 !
10450 ! print *,'entering cplesh depth = ',h
10451  k1x0=w1x0
10452  k1y0=w1y0
10453  k2x0=w2x0
10454  k2y0=w2y0
10455  k3x0=w3x0
10456  k3y0=w3y0
10457 
10458  tot1=0.
10459  tot2=0.
10460  tot3=0.
10461  tot4=0.
10462  tot5=0.
10463  z1=0.
10464  z2=0.
10465  z3=0.
10466  z4=0.
10467  z5=0.
10468  g=9.81
10469  gsq=g*g
10470 
10471  s1=1.
10472  s2=1.
10473  s3=-1.
10474 
10475 
10476  k1x=s1*k1x0
10477  k1y=s1*k1y0
10478  k2x=s2*k2x0
10479  k2y=s2*k2y0
10480  k3x=s3*k3x0
10481  k3y=s3*k3y0
10482 
10483  k1=sqrt(k1x**2+k1y**2)
10484  k2=sqrt(k2x**2+k2y**2)
10485  k3=sqrt(k3x**2+k3y**2)
10486 
10487  tnz1=tanz(k1*h)
10488  tnz2=tanz(k2*h)
10489  tnz3=tanz(k3*h)
10490  csz1=cosz(k1*h)
10491  csz2=cosz(k2*h)
10492  csz3=cosz(k3*h)
10493  om1=sqrt(g*k1*tnz1)
10494  om2=sqrt(g*k2*tnz2)
10495  om3=sqrt(g*k3*tnz3)
10496 
10497  som1=s1*om1
10498  som2=s2*om2
10499  som3=s3*om3
10500  dot23=k2x*k3x+k2y*k3y
10501 
10502  k23x=k2x+k3x
10503  k23y=k2y+k3y
10504  k23=sqrt(k23x**2+k23y**2)
10505  tnz23=tanz(k23*h)
10506  csz23=cosz(k23*h)
10507 
10508  omsq23=g*k23*tnz23
10509  dot123=k1x*k23x+k1y*k23y
10510 
10511 ! note the "i**2" factor is included in this term
10512  di=-(som2+som3)*(k2*k3*tnz2*tnz3-dot23) &
10513  +0.5*(som2*k3**2/(csz3)**2+som3*k2**2/(csz2)**2)
10514 
10515  e=0.5/g *(dot23-som2*som3/gsq*(om2**2+om3**2+som2*som3))
10516 
10517  p1=2.*(som1+som2+som3)*(om1**2.*omsq23/gsq-dot123)
10518 
10519  p2=-som1*(k23)**2/(csz23)**2
10520 
10521  p3=-(som2+som3)*k1**2/(csz1)**2
10522 
10523  z1=z1+di
10524  z2=z2+omsq23-(som2+som3)**2
10525  z3=z3+p1
10526  z4=z4+p2
10527  z5=z5+p3
10528  t1=di/(omsq23-(som2+som3)**2 + eps ) * (p1+p2+p3)
10529 
10530  t2=-di*som1/gsq *(om1**2+omsq23)
10531 
10532  p4=g*k1**2/(csz1)**2
10533 
10534  t3=e*(som1**3*(som2+som3)/g - g*dot123 - p4)
10535 
10536  t4=0.5*som1/gsq*dot23*((som1+som2+som3)*(om2**2+om3**2) &
10537  +som2*som3*(som2+som3))
10538 
10539  t5=-0.5*som1*om2**2*k3**2/gsq*(som1+som2+2.*som3) &
10540  -0.5*som1*om3**2*k2**2/gsq*(som1+2.*som2+som3)
10541 
10542  scpl1=t1+t2+t3+t4+t5
10543  tot1=tot1+t1
10544  tot2=tot2+t2
10545  tot3=tot3+t3
10546  tot4=tot4+t4
10547  tot5=tot5+t5
10548 
10549  s1=1.
10550  s2=-1.
10551  s3=1.
10552  k1zx=k1x0
10553  k1zy=k1y0
10554  k1x0=k2x0
10555  k1y0=k2y0
10556  k2x0=k3x0
10557  k2y0=k3y0
10558  k3x0=k1zx
10559  k3y0=k1zy
10560 
10561 
10562  k1x=s1*k1x0
10563  k1y=s1*k1y0
10564  k2x=s2*k2x0
10565  k2y=s2*k2y0
10566  k3x=s3*k3x0
10567  k3y=s3*k3y0
10568 
10569  k1=sqrt(k1x**2+k1y**2)
10570  k2=sqrt(k2x**2+k2y**2)
10571  k3=sqrt(k3x**2+k3y**2)
10572  tnz1=tanz(k1*h)
10573  tnz2=tanz(k2*h)
10574  tnz3=tanz(k3*h)
10575  csz1=cosz(k1*h)
10576  csz2=cosz(k2*h)
10577  csz3=cosz(k3*h)
10578  om1=sqrt(g*k1*tnz1)
10579  om2=sqrt(g*k2*tnz2)
10580  om3=sqrt(g*k3*tnz3)
10581  som1=s1*om1
10582  som2=s2*om2
10583  som3=s3*om3
10584  dot23=k2x*k3x+k2y*k3y
10585  k23x=k2x+k3x
10586  k23y=k2y+k3y
10587  k23=sqrt(k23x**2+k23y**2)
10588  tnz23=tanz(k23*h)
10589  csz23=cosz(k23*h)
10590  omsq23=g*k23*tnz23
10591  dot123=k1x*k23x+k1y*k23y
10592 
10593 ! note the "i**2" factor is included in this term
10594  di=-(som2+som3)*(k2*k3*tnz2*tnz3-dot23) &
10595  +0.5*(som2*k3**2/(csz3)**2+som3*k2**2/(csz2)**2)
10596 
10597  e=0.5/g *(dot23-som2*som3/gsq *(om2**2+om3**2+som2*som3))
10598 
10599  p1=2.*(som1+som2+som3)*(om1**2.*omsq23/gsq-dot123)
10600 
10601  p2=-som1*(k23)**2/(csz23)**2
10602 
10603  p3=-(som2+som3)*k1**2/(csz1)**2
10604  z1=z1+di
10605  z2=z2+omsq23-(som2+som3)**2
10606  z3=z3+p1
10607  z4=z4+p2
10608  z5=z5+p3
10609 
10610  t1=di/(omsq23-(som2+som3)**2) * (p1+p2+p3)
10611 
10612  t2=-di*som1/gsq *(om1**2+omsq23)
10613 
10614  p4=g*k1**2/(csz1)**2
10615 
10616  t3=e*(som1**3*(som2+som3)/g - g*dot123 - p4)
10617 
10618  t4=0.5*som1/gsq*dot23*((som1+som2+som3)*(om2**2+om3**2) &
10619  +som2*som3*(som2+som3))
10620 
10621  t5=-0.5*som1*om2**2*k3**2/gsq*(som1+som2+2.*som3) &
10622  -0.5*som1*om3**2*k2**2/gsq*(som1+2.*som2+som3)
10623 
10624  scpl2=t1+t2+t3+t4+t5
10625  tot1=tot1+t1
10626  tot2=tot2+t2
10627  tot3=tot3+t3
10628  tot4=tot4+t4
10629  tot5=tot5+t5
10630 
10631  s1=-1.
10632  s2=1.
10633  s3=1.
10634  k1zx=k1x0
10635  k1zy=k1y0
10636  k1x0=k2x0
10637  k1y0=k2y0
10638  k2x0=k3x0
10639  k2y0=k3y0
10640  k3x0=k1zx
10641  k3y0=k1zy
10642 
10643 
10644  k1x=s1*k1x0
10645  k1y=s1*k1y0
10646  k2x=s2*k2x0
10647  k2y=s2*k2y0
10648  k3x=s3*k3x0
10649  k3y=s3*k3y0
10650 
10651  k1=sqrt(k1x**2+k1y**2)
10652  k2=sqrt(k2x**2+k2y**2)
10653  k3=sqrt(k3x**2+k3y**2)
10654  tnz1=tanz(k1*h)
10655  tnz2=tanz(k2*h)
10656  tnz3=tanz(k3*h)
10657  csz1=cosz(k1*h)
10658  csz2=cosz(k2*h)
10659  csz3=cosz(k3*h)
10660  om1=sqrt(g*k1*tnz1)
10661  om2=sqrt(g*k2*tnz2)
10662  om3=sqrt(g*k3*tnz3)
10663  som1=s1*om1
10664  som2=s2*om2
10665  som3=s3*om3
10666  dot23=k2x*k3x+k2y*k3y
10667  k23x=k2x+k3x
10668  k23y=k2y+k3y
10669  k23=sqrt(k23x**2+k23y**2)
10670  tnz23=tanz(k23*h)
10671  csz23=cosz(k23*h)
10672  omsq23=g*k23*tnz23
10673  dot123=k1x*k23x+k1y*k23y
10674 
10675 ! note the "i**2" factor is included in this term
10676  di=-(som2+som3)*(k2*k3*tnz2*tnz3-dot23) &
10677  +0.5*(som2*k3**2/(csz3)**2+som3*k2**2/(csz2)**2)
10678 
10679  e=0.5/g *(dot23-som2*som3/gsq *(om2**2+om3**2+som2*som3))
10680 
10681  p1=2.*(som1+som2+som3)*(om1**2.*omsq23/gsq-dot123)
10682 
10683  p2=-som1*(k23)**2/(csz23)**2
10684 
10685  p3=-(som2+som3)*k1**2/(csz1)**2
10686  z1=z1+di
10687  z2=z2+omsq23-(som2+som3)**2
10688  z3=z3+p1
10689  z4=z4+p2
10690  z5=z5+p3
10691 
10692  t1=di/(omsq23-(som2+som3)**2) * (p1+p2+p3)
10693 
10694  t2=-di*som1/gsq*(om1**2+omsq23)
10695 
10696  p4=g*k1**2/(cosz(k1*h))**2
10697 
10698  t3=e*(som1**3*(som2+som3)/g - g*dot123 - p4)
10699 
10700  t4=0.5*som1/gsq*dot23*((som1+som2+som3)*(om2**2+om3**2) &
10701  +som2*som3*(som2+som3))
10702 
10703  t5=-0.5*som1*om2**2*k3**2/gsq*(som1+som2+2.*som3) &
10704  -0.5*som1*om3**2*k2**2/gsq*(som1+2.*som2+som3)
10705 
10706  scpl3=t1+t2+t3+t4+t5
10707  tot1=tot1+t1
10708  tot2=tot2+t2
10709  tot3=tot3+t3
10710  tot4=tot4+t4
10711  tot5=tot5+t5
10712 
10713  stot=(scpl1+scpl2+scpl3)
10714  om4=om2+om3-om1
10715  dsq=stot*stot*pi4*gsq/(om1*om2*om3*om4+eps) ! eps by GVV
10716  xc_hh = dsq
10717 !
10718 ! possible bug fixed
10719 !
10720  xc_hh = xc_hh*gsq
10721 !
10722  RETURN
10723  end function
10724 
10725  real function tanz(x)
10726  real x
10727 ! print *,'inside tanz '
10728  if (x.gt.20.) x=25.
10729  tanz=tanh(x)
10730 ! print *,'after def of tanz'
10731  return
10732  end function
10733 
10734  real function cosz(x)
10735  real x
10736  if (x.gt.20.) x=25.
10737  cosz=cosh(x)
10738  return
10739  end function
10740 
10741 
10742 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10743  real function xc_webb(k1x,k1y,k2x,k2y,k3x,k3y,k4x,k4y,grav_w)
10744 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10745 !
10746 ! +-------+ ALKYON Hydraulic Consultancy & Research
10747 ! | | Gerbrant van Vledder
10748 ! | +---+
10749 ! | | +---+ Last update: 10 Sep. 2002
10750 ! +---+ | | Release: 5.0
10751 ! +---+
10752 !
10753 !
10754 ! SWAN (Simulating WAves Nearshore); a third generation wave model
10755 ! Copyright (C) 2004-2005 Delft University of Technology
10756 !
10757 ! This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
10758 ! modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as
10759 ! published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of
10760 ! the License, or (at your option) any later version.
10761 !
10762 ! This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
10763 ! but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
10764 ! MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
10765 ! GNU General Public License for more details.
10766 !
10767 ! A copy of the GNU General Public License is available at
10768 ! http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html#SEC3
10769 ! or by writing to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
10770 ! 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA
10771 !
10772 !
10773  implicit none
10774 !
10775 ! 0. Update history
10776 !
10777 ! 25/02/1999 Initial version
10778 ! 10/09/2002 Upgrade of documention and interface
10779 !
10780 ! 1. Purpose:
10781 !
10782 ! Compute deep water coupling coefficient for
10783 ! non-linear quadruplet interactions
10784 !
10785 !
10786 ! 2. Method
10787 !
10788 ! Webb (1978) and modified and corrected by Dungey and Hui (1979)
10789 !
10790 ! 3. Parameter list:
10791 !
10792 ! Type I/O Name Description
10793 !--------------------------------------------------------------------
10794  real, intent(in) :: k1x ! x-component of wave number k1
10795  real, intent(in) :: k1y ! y-component of wave number k1
10796  real, intent(in) :: k2x ! x-component of wave number k2
10797  real, intent(in) :: k2y ! y-component of wave number k2
10798  real, intent(in) :: k3x ! x-component of wave number k3
10799  real, intent(in) :: k3y ! y-component of wave number k3
10800  real, intent(in) :: k4x ! x-component of wave number k4
10801  real, intent(in) :: k4y ! y-component of wave number k4
10802  real, intent(in) :: grav_w ! gravitational acceleration m/s^2
10803 !
10804 ! 4. Error messages
10805 !
10806 ! 5. Called by:
10807 !
10808 ! X_CPLE
10809 !
10810 ! 6. Subroutines used:
10811 !
10812 ! 7. Remarks
10813 !
10814 ! 8. Structure
10815 !
10816 ! 9. Switches
10817 !
10818 ! 10. Source code:
10819 !------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10820 ! local variables
10821 !
10822 !
10823  double precision wsqp12 ! derived variable
10824  double precision wsqm13 ! derived variable
10825  double precision wsq13 ! derived variable
10826  double precision wsqm14 ! derived variable
10827  double precision wsq14 ! derived variable
10828  double precision wsq12 ! derived variable
10829  real z,z12,z13,z14 ! derived variables
10830  real dwebb ! final coefficient
10831  real p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,p6,p7,p8,p9 ! partial summations
10832  real w1,w2,w3,w4 ! radian frequencies
10833  real k1,k2,k3,k4 ! wave number magnitudes
10834  real dot12 ! k1*k2
10835  real dot13 ! k1*k3
10836  real dot14 ! k1*k4
10837  real dot23 ! k2*k3
10838  real dot24 ! k2*k4
10839  real dot34 ! k3*k4
10840  real pi_w ! pi
10841  real pi4 ! pi/4
10842  real eps ! internal accuracy
10843 !---------------------------------------------------------------------
10844 ! initialisations
10845 !---------------------------------------------------------------------
10846  pi_w = 4.*atan(1.)
10847  pi4 = 0.25*pi_w
10848 !
10849  eps = 1.0e-30
10850 !
10851  k1 = sqrt(k1x*k1x + k1y*k1y)
10852  k2 = sqrt(k2x*k2x + k2y*k2y)
10853  k3 = sqrt(k3x*k3x + k3y*k3y)
10854  k4 = sqrt(k4x*k4x + k4y*k4y)
10855 !
10856  w1 = sqrt(k1)
10857  w2 = sqrt(k2)
10858  w3 = sqrt(k3)
10859  w4 = sqrt(k4)
10860 !
10861  dot12 = k1x*k2x + k1y*k2y
10862  dot13 = k1x*k3x + k1y*k3y
10863  dot14 = k1x*k4x + k1y*k4y
10864  dot23 = k2x*k3x + k2y*k3y
10865  dot24 = k2x*k4x + k2y*k4y
10866  dot34 = k3x*k4x + k3y*k4y
10867 !
10868  wsqp12= sqrt((k1x+k2x)*(k1x+k2x)+(k1y+k2y)*(k1y+k2y))
10869  wsq12 = (w1+w2)*(w1+w2)
10870  wsqm13= sqrt((k1x-k3x)*(k1x-k3x)+(k1y-k3y)*(k1y-k3y))
10871  wsq13 = (w1-w3)*(w1-w3)
10872  wsqm14= sqrt((k1x-k4x)*(k1x-k4x)+(k1y-k4y)*(k1y-k4y))
10873  wsq14 = (w1-w4)*(w1-w4)
10874  z12 = wsqp12-wsq12
10875  z13 = wsqm13-wsq13
10876  z14 = wsqm14-wsq14
10877  z = 2.*wsq12*(k1*k2-dot12)*(k3*k4-dot34)
10878  p1 = z/(z12+eps)
10879  z = 2.*wsq13*(k1*k3+dot13)*(k2*k4+dot24)
10880  p2 = z/(z13+eps)
10881  z = 2.*wsq14*(k1*k4+dot14)*(k2*k3+dot23)
10882  p3 = z/(z14+eps)
10883  p4 = 0.5 *(dot12*dot34 + dot13*dot24 + dot14*dot23)
10884  p5 = 0.25*(dot13+dot24) * wsq13 * wsq13
10885  p6 = -0.25*(dot12+dot34) * wsq12 * wsq12
10886  p7 = 0.25*(dot14+dot23) * wsq14 * wsq14
10887  p8 = 2.5*k1*k2*k3*k4
10888  p9 = wsq12*wsq13*wsq14* (k1 + k2 + k3 + k4)
10889 !
10890  dwebb = p1 + p2 + p3 + p4 + p5 + p6 + p7 + p8 + p9
10891  xc_webb = grav_w**2*pi4*dwebb*dwebb/(w1*w2*w3*w4+eps)
10892 !
10893  return
10894  end function
10895 !
10896  end module
m_xnldata::s_mod
real, dimension(:), allocatable s_mod
Definition: swmod3.F:1832
m_xnldata::mk1a
integer mk1a
Definition: swmod3.F:1975

integer iq_lump
